Path: play_date/PlayDateApp/.expo/README.md
 1	> Why do I have a folder named ".expo" in my project?
 2	The ".expo" folder is created when an Expo project is started using "expo start" command.
 3	> What do the files contain?
 4	- "devices.json": contains information about devices that have recently opened this project. This is used to populate the "Development sessions" list in your development builds.
 5	- "settings.json": contains the server configuration that is used to serve the application manifest.
 6	> Should I commit the ".expo" folder?
 7	No, you should not share the ".expo" folder. It does not contain any information that is relevant for other developers working on the project, it is specific to your machine.
 8	Upon project creation, the ".expo" folder is already added to your ".gitignore" file.

Path: play_date/PlayDateApp/ARCHITECTURE.md
 1	# Coplay App Architecture
 2	
 3	## Technology Stack
 4	
 5	### Frontend
 6	- **Framework**: React Native with Expo SDK 53
 7	- **Language**: TypeScript
 8	- **Navigation**: React Navigation (to be implemented)
 9	- **State Management**: React Context API + useReducer
 10	- **Styling**: StyleSheet with custom theme system
 11	- **Development**: Expo CLI for development and testing
 12	
 13	### Backend (Planned)
 14	- **Runtime**: Node.js
 15	- **Framework**: Express.js
 16	- **Database**: PostgreSQL (primary) + Redis (caching/sessions)
 17	- **Real-time**: Socket.io for game synchronization
 18	- **Authentication**: JWT tokens
 19	- **File Storage**: AWS S3 or similar for photos
 20	- **Deployment**: Docker containers on AWS/GCP
 21	
 22	## Project Structure
 23	
 24	```
 25	CoplayApp/
 26	├── src/
 27	│ ├── components/ # Reusable UI components
 28	│ │ ├── common/ # Generic components (Button, Input, etc.)
 29	│ │ ├── game/ # Game-specific components
 30	│ │ └── profile/ # Profile-related components
 31	│ │
 32	│ ├── screens/ # Screen components

 149	
 150	// Debounce utility
 151	export const debounce = <T extends (...args: any[]) => any>(
 152	 func: T,
 153	 wait: number
 154	): ((...args: Parameters<T>) => void) => {
 155	 let timeout: NodeJS.Timeout;
 156	 return (...args: Parameters<T>) => {
 157	 clearTimeout(timeout);
 158	 timeout = setTimeout(() => func(...args), wait);
 159	 };
 160	};
 161	
 162	// Game utilities
 163	export const calculateGameScore = (
 164	 success: boolean,
 165	 duration: number,
 166	 maxDuration: number
 167	): number => {
 168	 if (!success) return 0;
 169	 
 170	 const timeBonus = Math.max(0, (maxDuration - duration) / maxDuration);
 171	 const baseScore = 100;
 172	 return Math.round(baseScore + (timeBonus * 50));
 173	};

 1	# Use Python 3.11 slim image
 2	FROM python:3.11-slim
 3	
 4	# Set working directory
 5	WORKDIR /app
 6	
 7	# Set environment variables
 8	ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
 9	ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
 10	
 11	# Install system dependencies
 12	RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
 13	 gcc \
 14	 && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
 15	
 16	# Copy requirements first for better caching
 17	COPY requirements.txt .
 18	
 19	# Install Python dependencies
 20	RUN pip install --no-cache-dir -r requirements.txt
 21	
 22	# Copy application code
 23	COPY . .
 24	
 25	# Create non-root user
 26	RUN adduser --disabled-password --gecos '' appuser && chown -R appuser /app
 27	USER appuser
 28	
 29	# Expose port
 30	EXPOSE 5000
 31	
 32	# Health check
 33	HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=30s --start-period=5s --retries=3 \
 34	 CMD curl -f http://localhost:5000/health || exit 1

 1	# Coplay Flask API
 2	
 3	A simple Flask REST API with Docker support for the Coplay project.
 4	
 5	## Features
 6	
 7	- RESTful API endpoints for user management
 8	- CORS enabled for frontend integration
 9	- Docker containerization
 10	- Health check endpoint
 11	- Production-ready with Gunicorn
 12	
 13	## API Endpoints
 14	
 15	- `GET /` - Welcome message and API info
 16	- `GET /health` - Health check endpoint
 17	- `GET /users` - Get all users
 18	- `GET /users/<id>` - Get user by ID
 19	- `POST /users` - Create new user
 20	- `PUT /users/<id>` - Update user
 21	- `DELETE /users/<id>` - Delete user
 22	
 23	## Quick Start
 24	
 25	### Using Docker Compose (Recommended)
 26	
 27	1. Build and run the container:
 28	```bash
 29	docker-compose up --build
 30	```
 31	
 32	2. The API will be available at `http://localhost:5000`
 33	
 34	### Using Docker directly
 35	
 36	1. Build the image:
 37	```bash
 38	docker build -t coplay-api .
 39	```
 40	
 41	2. Run the container:
 42	```bash
 43	docker run -p 5000:5000 coplay-api
 44	```
 45	
 46	### Local Development (without Docker)
 47	
 48	1. Install dependencies:
 49	```bash
 50	pip install -r requirements.txt
 51	```
 52	
 53	2. Run the application:
 54	```bash
 55	python app.py
 56	```
 57	
 58	## Testing the API
 59	
 60	Test the endpoints using curl:
 61	
 62	```bash
 63	# Get all users
 64	curl http://localhost:5000/users
 65	
 66	# Create a new user
 67	curl -X POST http://localhost:5000/users \
 68	 -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
 69	 -d '{"name": "John Doe", "email": "john@example.com"}'
 70	
 71	# Get user by ID
 72	curl http://localhost:5000/users/1
 73	
 74	# Update user
 75	curl -X PUT http://localhost:5000/users/1 \
 76	 -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
 77	 -d '{"name": "Jane Doe", "email": "jane@example.com"}'
 78	
 79	# Delete user
 80	curl -X DELETE http://localhost:5000/users/1
 81	```
 82	
 83	## Environment Variables
 84	
 85	- `PORT` - Port to run the application (default: 5000)
 86	- `FLASK_DEBUG` - Enable debug mode (default: False)
 87	
 88	## Project Structure
 89	
 90	```
 91	coplay/
 92	├── app.py # Main Flask application
 93	├── requirements.txt # Python dependencies
 94	├── Dockerfile # Docker configuration
 95	├── docker-compose.yml # Docker Compose configuration
 96	├── .dockerignore # Docker ignore file
 97	└── README.md # This file
 98	```
 99	
Total lines in file: 99

 145	
 146	## API Design
 147	
 148	### Authentication Endpoints
 149	- `POST /auth/register` - User registration
 150	- `POST /auth/login` - User login
 151	- `POST /auth/refresh` - Token refresh
 152	- `POST /auth/logout` - User logout
 153	
 154	### User Management
 155	- `GET /users/profile` - Get user profile
 156	- `PUT /users/profile` - Update user profile
 157	- `POST /users/photos` - Upload profile photos
 158	
 159	### Matching System
 160	- `GET /matches/candidates` - Get potential matches
 161	- `POST /matches/like` - Like a user
 162	- `GET /matches` - Get user's matches
 163	
 164	### Game System
 165	- `POST /games/invite` - Send game invitation
 166	- `POST /games/session` - Create game session
 167	- `GET /games/session/:id` - Get game session
 168	- `PUT /games/session/:id` - Update game state
 169	
 170	## Security Considerations

 21	
 22	export const formatGameDuration = (seconds: number): string => {
 23	 const minutes = Math.floor(seconds / 60);
 24	 const remainingSeconds = seconds % 60;
 25	 return `${minutes}:${remainingSeconds.toString().padStart(2, '0')}`;
 26	};
 27	
 28	// Distance calculation utilities
 29	export const calculateDistance = (
 30	 lat1: number,
 31	 lon1: number,
 32	 lat2: number,
 33	 lon2: number
 34	): number => {
 35	 const R = 6371; // Radius of the Earth in kilometers
 36	 const dLat = deg2rad(lat2 - lat1);
 37	 const dLon = deg2rad(lon2 - lon1);
 38	 const a =
 39	 Math.sin(dLat / 2) * Math.sin(dLat / 2) +
 40	 Math.cos(deg2rad(lat1)) * Math.cos(deg2rad(lat2)) *
 41	 Math.sin(dLon / 2) * Math.sin(dLon / 2);
 42	 const c = 2 * Math.atan2(Math.sqrt(a), Math.sqrt(1 - a));
 43	 const distance = R * c; // Distance in kilometers
 44	 return Math.round(distance);
 45	};
 46	
 47	const deg2rad = (deg: number): number => {
 48	 return deg * (Math.PI / 180);
 49	};
 50	
 51	export const formatDistance = (distance: number): string => {
 52	 if (distance < 1) {
 53	 return 'Less than 1 km away';
 54	 } else if (distance === 1) {
 55	 return '1 km away';
 56	 } else {
 57	 return `${distance} km away`;
 58	 }
 59	};
 60	
 61	// Validation utilities
 62	export const validateEmail = (email: string): boolean => {
 63	 const emailRegex = /^[^\s@]+@[^\s@]+\.[^\s@]+$/;
 64	 return emailRegex.test(email);
 65	};

 98	
 99	// String utilities
 100	export const truncateText = (text: string, maxLength: number): string => {
 101	 if (text.length <= maxLength) {
 102	 return text;
 103	 }
 104	 return text.substring(0, maxLength - 3) + '...';
 105	};
 106	
 107	export const capitalizeFirstLetter = (text: string): string => {
 108	 return text.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + text.slice(1);
 109	};
 110	
 111	export const generateInitials = (name: string): string => {
 112	 return name
 113	 .split(' ')
 114	 .map(word => word.charAt(0).toUpperCase())
 115	 .join('')
 116	 .substring(0, 2);
 117	};
 118	
 119	// Array utilities
 120	export const shuffleArray = <T>(array: T[]): T[] => {
 121	 const shuffled = [...array];
 122	 for (let i = shuffled.length - 1; i > 0; i--) {
 123	 const j = Math.floor(Math.random() * (i + 1));
 124	 [shuffled[i], shuffled[j]] = [shuffled[j], shuffled[i]];
 125	 }
 126	 return shuffled;
 127	};
 128	
 129	export const getRandomElement = <T>(array: T[]): T => {
 130	 return array[Math.floor(Math.random() * array.length)];
 131	};
 132	
 133	// Number utilities
 134	export const clamp = (value: number, min: number, max: number): number => {
 135	 return Math.min(Math.max(value, min), max);
 136	};
 137	
 138	export const randomBetween = (min: number, max: number): number => {
 139	 return Math.floor(Math.random() * (max - min + 1)) + min;
 140	};
 141	
 142	// Color utilities
 143	export const hexToRgba = (hex: string, alpha: number): string => {
 144	 const r = parseInt(hex.slice(1, 3), 16);
 145	 const g = parseInt(hex.slice(3, 5), 16);
 146	 const b = parseInt(hex.slice(5, 7), 16);
 147	 return `rgba(${r}, ${g}, ${b}, ${alpha})`;
 148	};
 149	
 150	// Debounce utility
 151	export const debounce = <T extends (...args: any[]) => any>(
 152	 func: T,
 153	 wait: number
 154	): ((...args: Parameters<T>) => void) => {
 155	 let timeout: NodeJS.Timeout;
 156	 return (...args: Parameters<T>) => {
 157	 clearTimeout(timeout);
 158	 timeout = setTimeout(() => func(...args), wait);
 159	 };
 160	};
 161	
 162	// Game utilities
 163	export const calculateGameScore = (
 164	 success: boolean,
 165	 duration: number,
 166	 maxDuration: number
 167	): number => {
 168	 if (!success) return 0;
 169	 
 170	 const timeBonus = Math.max(0, (maxDuration - duration) / maxDuration);
 171	 const baseScore = 100;
 172	 return Math.round(baseScore + (timeBonus * 50));
 173	};
 174	
 175	export const getGameDifficulty = (playerLevel: number): 'easy' | 'medium' | 'hard' => {
 176	 if (playerLevel < 5) return 'easy';
 177	 if (playerLevel < 15) return 'medium';
 178	 return 'hard';
 179	};
 180	
 181	// Error handling utilities
 182	export const getErrorMessage = (error: any): string => {
 183	 if (typeof error === 'string') {
 184	 return error;
 185	 }
 186	 
 187	 if (error?.message) {
 188	 return error.message;
 189	 }
 190	 
 191	 if (error?.response?.data?.message) {
 192	 return error.response.data.message;
 193	 }
 194	 
 195	 return 'An unexpected error occurred';
 196	};
 197

 201	 USER_DATA: 'user_data',
 202	 GAME_SETTINGS: 'game_settings',
 203	 ONBOARDING_COMPLETED: 'onboarding_completed',
 204	} as const;

 211	 MAX_PHOTOS: 6,
 212	 MIN_AGE: 18,
 213	 MAX_AGE: 100,
 214	 MAX_DISTANCE: 100, // kilometers

 1	from flask import Flask, jsonify, request
 2	from flask_cors import CORS
 3	import os
 4	
 5	app = Flask(__name__)
 6	CORS(app) # Enable CORS for all routes
 7	
 8	# Sample data
 9	users = [
 10	 {"id": 1, "name": "Alice", "email": "alice@example.com"},
 11	 {"id": 2, "name": "Bob", "email": "bob@example.com"},
 12	 {"id": 3, "name": "Charlie", "email": "charlie@example.com"}
 13	]
 14	
 15	@app.route('/')
 16	def hello():
 17	 return jsonify({
 18	 "message": "Welcome to PlayDate API!",
 19	 "version": "1.0.0",
 20	 "status": "running"
 21	 })
 22	
 23	@app.route('/health')
 24	def health_check():
 25	 return jsonify({"status": "healthy"}), 200
 26	
 27	@app.route('/users', methods=['GET'])
 28	def get_users():
 29	 return jsonify({"users": users})
 30	
 31	@app.route('/users/<int:user_id>', methods=['GET'])
 32	def get_user(user_id):
 33	 user = next((u for u in users if u["id"] == user_id), None)
 34	 if user:
 35	 return jsonify({"user": user})
 36	 return jsonify({"error": "User not found"}), 404
 37	
 38	@app.route('/users', methods=['POST'])
 39	def create_user():
 40	 data = request.get_json()
 41	 if not data or 'name' not in data or 'email' not in data:
 42	 return jsonify({"error": "Name and email are required"}), 400
 43	 
 44	 new_user = {
 45	 "id": max([u["id"] for u in users]) + 1 if users else 1,
 46	 "name": data["name"],
 47	 "email": data["email"]
 48	 }
 49	 users.append(new_user)
 50	 return jsonify({"user": new_user}), 201

Path: play_date/api/README.md
 1	# PlayDate Flask API
 2	
 3	A simple Flask REST API with Docker support for the PlayDate project.
 4	
 5	## Features
 6	
 7	- RESTful API endpoints for user management
 8	- CORS enabled for frontend integration
 9	- Docker containerization
 10	- Health check endpoint
 11	- Production-ready with Gunicorn
 12	
 13	## API Endpoints
 14	
 15	- `GET /` - Welcome message and API info
 16	- `GET /health` - Health check endpoint
 17	- `GET /users` - Get all users
 18	- `GET /users/<id>` - Get user by ID
 19	- `POST /users` - Create new user
 20	- `PUT /users/<id>` - Update user
 21	- `DELETE /users/<id>` - Delete user
 22	
 23	## Quick Start
 24	
 25	### Using Docker Compose (Recommended)
 26	
 27	1. Build and run the container:
 28	```bash
 29	docker-compose up --build
 30	```
 31	
 32	2. The API will be available at `http://localhost:5000`
 33	
 34	### Using Docker directly
 35	
 36	1. Build the image:
 37	```bash
 38	docker build -t playdate-api .
 39	```
 40	
 41	2. Run the container:
 42	```bash
 43	docker run -p 5000:5000 playdate-api
 44	```
 45	
 46	### Local Development (without Docker)
 47	
 48	1. Install dependencies:
 49	```bash
 50	pip install -r requirements.txt
 51	```
 52	
 53	2. Run the application:
 54	```bash
 55	python app.py
 56	```
 57	
 58	## Testing the API
 59	
 60	Test the endpoints using curl:
 61	
 62	```bash
 63	# Get all users
 64	curl http://localhost:5000/users
 65	
 66	# Create a new user
 67	curl -X POST http://localhost:5000/users \
 68	 -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
 69	 -d '{"name": "John Doe", "email": "john@example.com"}'
 70	
 71	# Get user by ID
 72	curl http://localhost:5000/users/1
 73	
 74	# Update user
 75	curl -X PUT http://localhost:5000/users/1 \
 76	 -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
 77	 -d '{"name": "Jane Doe", "email": "jane@example.com"}'
 78	
 79	# Delete user
 80	curl -X DELETE http://localhost:5000/users/1
 81	```
 82	
 83	## Environment Variables
 84	
 85	- `PORT` - Port to run the application (default: 5000)
 86	- `FLASK_DEBUG` - Enable debug mode (default: False)
 87	
 88	## Project Structure
 89	
 90	```
 91	playdate/
 92	├── app.py # Main Flask application
 93	├── requirements.txt # Python dependencies
 94	├── Dockerfile # Docker configuration
 95	├── docker-compose.yml # Docker Compose configuration
 96	├── .dockerignore # Docker ignore file
 97	└── README.md # This file
 98	```

Path: play_date/api/Dockerfile
 1	# Use Python 3.11 slim image
 2	FROM python:3.11-slim
 3	
 4	# Set working directory
 5	WORKDIR /app
 6	
 7	# Set environment variables
 8	ENV PYTHONDONTWRITEBYTECODE=1
 9	ENV PYTHONUNBUFFERED=1
 10	
 11	# Install system dependencies
 12	RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y \
 13	 gcc \
 14	 && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
 15	
 16	# Copy requirements first for better caching
 17	COPY requirements.txt .
 18	
 19	# Install Python dependencies
 20	RUN pip install --no-cache-dir -r requirements.txt
 21	
 22	# Copy application code
 23	COPY . .
 24	
 25	# Create non-root user
 26	RUN adduser --disabled-password --gecos '' appuser && chown -R appuser /app
 27	USER appuser
 28	
 29	# Expose port
 30	EXPOSE 5000
 31	
 32	# Health check
 33	HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=30s --start-period=5s --retries=3 \
 34	 CMD curl -f http://localhost:5000/health || exit 1

","isError":false,"requestId":""}}},"draftExchange":{"request_message":"1. Puzzle Connect

Type: Cooperative puzzle-solving.

Duration: 2–3 minutes per round.

Gameplay: Players see different puzzle states and must share clues to solve a shared grid.

Co-op Mechanic: Neither player can solve alone; asymmetric information drives communication.

Tech Needs: 2D grid mechanic, synchronized game state, optional timer.

Design: Minimal, pastel aesthetic, smooth success animations.

2. Guess & Draw

Type: Turn-based drawing & guessing.

Duration: 1–2 minutes per round.

Gameplay: One player draws from a prompt, the other guesses.

Co-op Mechanic: Both must succeed together (drawer communicates, guesser interprets).

Tech Needs: Canvas drawing tool, real-time stroke sync, word bank in backend.

Design: Limited pen colors, playful animations, correct-guess effects.

3. Survival Challenge

Type: Reflex/timing game.

Duration: 1–3 minutes per round.

Gameplay: Both players control avatars dodging obstacles. If one fails, both lose.

Co-op Mechanic: Both must survive together; requires timing and communication.

Tech Needs: Real-time movement sync, collision detection, randomized obstacles.

Design: Flat minimalist style (inspired by Duet), celebratory effects for wins.","rich_text_json_repr":{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1. Puzzle Connect

Type: Cooperative puzzle-solving.

Duration: 2–3 minutes per round.

Gameplay: Players see different puzzle states and must share clues to solve a shared grid.

Co-op Mechanic: Neither player can solve alone; asymmetric information drives communication.

Tech Needs: 2D grid mechanic, synchronized game state, optional timer.

Design: Minimal, pastel aesthetic, smooth success animations.

2. Guess & Draw

Type: Turn-based drawing & guessing.

Duration: 1–2 minutes per round.

Gameplay: One player draws from a prompt, the other guesses.

Co-op Mechanic: Both must succeed together (drawer communicates, guesser interprets).

Tech Needs: Canvas drawing tool, real-time stroke sync, word bank in backend.

Design: Limited pen colors, playful animations, correct-guess effects.

3. Survival Challenge

Type: Reflex/timing game.

Duration: 1–3 minutes per round.

Gameplay: Both players control avatars dodging obstacles. If one fails, both lose.

Co-op Mechanic: Both must survive together; requires timing and communication.

Tech Needs: Real-time movement sync, collision detection, randomized obstacles.

 1	# PlayDate - Dating App with Cooperative Games
 2	
 3	A mobile-first dating application that connects users through simple, cooperative 2-player games.
 4	
 5	## Project Overview
 6	
 7	PlayDate differentiates itself by offering users the ability to connect through casual cooperative games, prioritizing minimalism, ease of use, and a professional design aesthetic.
 8	
 9	## Tech Stack
 10	
 11	- **Frontend**: React Native with Expo
 12	- **Language**: TypeScript
 13	- **Navigation**: React Navigation (to be added)
 14	- **State Management**: React Context + Hooks
 15	- **Backend**: Node.js/Express (to be implemented)
 16	- **Database**: PostgreSQL + Redis
 17	- **Real-time**: WebSocket/Socket.io
 18	
 19	## Project Structure
 20	
 21	```
 22	src/
 23	├── components/ # Reusable UI components
 24	├── screens/ # Screen components
 25	│ ├── Auth/ # Authentication screens
 26	│ ├── Profile/ # Profile management
 27	│ ├── Matching/ # Matchmaking screens
 28	│ ├── Games/ # Game lobby and results
 29	│ └── Chat/ # Chat functionality
 30	├── games/ # Game implementations
 31	│ ├── PuzzleConnect/ # Cooperative puzzle game
 32	│ ├── GuessAndDraw/ # Drawing and guessing game
 33	│ └── SurvivalChallenge/ # Reflex/timing game
 34	├── navigation/ # Navigation configuration
 35	├── services/ # API and external services
 36	├── hooks/ # Custom React hooks
 37	├── contexts/ # React contexts
...

 1	# PlayDate App Architecture
 2	
 3	## Technology Stack
 4	
 5	### Frontend
 6	- **Framework**: React Native with Expo SDK 53
 7	- **Language**: TypeScript
 8	- **Navigation**: React Navigation (to be implemented)
 9	- **State Management**: React Context API + useReducer
 10	- **Styling**: StyleSheet with custom theme system
 11	- **Development**: Expo CLI for development and testing
 12	
 13	### Backend (Planned)
 14	- **Runtime**: Node.js
 15	- **Framework**: Express.js
 16	- **Database**: PostgreSQL (primary) + Redis (caching/sessions)
 17	- **Real-time**: Socket.io for game synchronization
 18	- **Authentication**: JWT tokens
 19	- **File Storage**: AWS S3 or similar for photos
 20	- **Deployment**: Docker containers on AWS/GCP
 21	
 22	## Project Structure
 23	
 24	```
 25	PlayDateApp/

 125	
 126	### Data Flow
 127	1. UI components dispatch actions to contexts
 128	2. Contexts manage local state and API calls
 129	3. Services handle API communication and WebSocket events
 130	4. Real-time updates flow through WebSocket to contexts
 131	
 132	## Game Architecture
 133	
 134	### Common Game Framework
 135	All games follow a consistent structure:
 136	- **Game Session**: Manages overall game state
 137	- **Player Interface**: Handles user input and display
 138	- **Synchronization**: Real-time state sync between players
 139	- **Results**: Score calculation and result display
 140	
 141	### Game-Specific Implementations
 142	1. **Puzzle Connect**: Grid-based puzzle with asymmetric information
 143	2. **Guess & Draw**: Canvas drawing with real-time stroke synchronization
 144	3. **Survival Challenge**: Physics-based collision detection

 1	# PlayDate Flask API
 2	
 3	A Flask REST API with PostgreSQL database and Docker support for the PlayDate project.
 4	
 5	## Features
 6	
 7	- RESTful API endpoints for user management and authentication
 8	- PostgreSQL database with SQLAlchemy ORM
 9	- CORS enabled for frontend integration
 10	- Docker containerization with multi-service setup
 11	- Health check endpoints with database connectivity
 12	- Production-ready with Gunicorn
 13	- Database migrations and initialization
 14	
 15	## API Endpoints
 16	
 17	### General
 18	- `GET /` - Welcome message and API info
 19	- `GET /health` - Health check endpoint with database status
 20	
 21	### Authentication
 22	- `POST /auth/register` - Register new user
 23	- `POST /auth/login` - User login

 97	
 98	 private async request<T>(
 99	 endpoint: string,
 100	 options: RequestInit = {}
 101	 ): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 102	 try {
 103	 const url = `${this.baseURL}${endpoint}`;
 104	 const token = await tokenManager.getToken();
 105	
 106	 const headers: HeadersInit = {
 107	 'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 108	 ...options.headers,
 109	 };
 110	
 111	 if (token) {
 112	 headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`;
 113	 }
 114	
 115	 const response = await fetch(url, {
 116	 ...options,
 117	 headers,
 118	 });
 119	
 120	 const data = await response.json();
 121	
 122	 if (!response.ok) {
 123	 // Handle token expiration
 124	 if (response.status === 401 && token) {
 125	 await tokenManager.removeToken();
 126	 return {
 127	 error: 'Session expired. Please log in again.',
 128	 };
 129	 }
 130	
 131	 return {
 132	 error: data.error || `HTTP ${response.status}: ${response.statusText}`,
 133	 };
 134	 }
 135	
 136	 return { data };
 137	 } catch (error) {
 138	 console.error('API request failed:', error);
 139	 return {
 140	 error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Network request failed',
 141	 };
 142	 }
 143	 }
 144	
 145	 async get<T>(endpoint: string): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 146	 return this.request<T>(endpoint, { method: 'GET' });
 147	 }
 148	
 149	 async post<T>(endpoint: string, body?: any): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 150	 return this.request<T>(endpoint, {
 151	 method: 'POST',
 152	 body: body ? JSON.stringify(body) : undefined,
 153	 });
 154	 }
 155	
 156	 async put<T>(endpoint: string, body?: any): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 157	 return this.request<T>(endpoint, {
 158	 method: 'PUT',
 159	 body: body ? JSON.stringify(body) : undefined,
 160	 });
 161	 }
 162	
 163	 async delete<T>(endpoint: string): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 164	 return this.request<T>(endpoint, { method: 'DELETE' });
 165	 }
 166	}

 42	## MVP Games
 43	
 44	### 1. Puzzle Connect
 45	- **Type**: Cooperative puzzle-solving
 46	- **Duration**: 2–3 minutes per round
 47	- **Gameplay**: Players see different puzzle states and must share clues to solve a shared grid
 48	- **Co-op Mechanic**: Neither player can solve alone; asymmetric information drives communication
 49	
 50	### 2. Guess & Draw
 51	- **Type**: Turn-based drawing & guessing
 52	- **Duration**: 1–2 minutes per round
 53	- **Gameplay**: One player draws from a prompt, the other guesses
 54	- **Co-op Mechanic**: Both must succeed together (drawer communicates, guesser interprets)

 125	
 126	### Data Flow
 127	1. UI components dispatch actions to contexts
 128	2. Contexts manage local state and API calls
 129	3. Services handle API communication and WebSocket events
 130	4. Real-time updates flow through WebSocket to contexts
 131	
 132	## Game Architecture
 133	
 134	### Common Game Framework
 135	All games follow a consistent structure:
 136	- **Game Session**: Manages overall game state
 137	- **Player Interface**: Handles user input and display
 138	- **Synchronization**: Real-time state sync between players
 139	- **Results**: Score calculation and result display
 140	
 141	### Game-Specific Implementations
 142	1. **Puzzle Connect**: Grid-based puzzle with asymmetric information
 143	2. **Guess & Draw**: Canvas drawing with real-time stroke synchronization
 144	3. **Survival Challenge**: Physics-based collision detection

 1	import React, { createContext, useContext, useReducer, useEffect, ReactNode } from 'react';
 2	import { User, AuthState } from '../types';
 3	import { authService, tokenManager } from '../services/api';
 4	import { mapApiUserToUser, mapRegisterDataToApi } from '../services/userMapper';
 5	
 6	// Auth Actions
 7	type AuthAction =
 8	 | { type: 'AUTH_START' }
 9	 | { type: 'AUTH_SUCCESS'; payload: User }
 10	 | { type: 'AUTH_FAILURE'; payload: string }
 11	 | { type: 'LOGOUT' }
 12	 | { type: 'UPDATE_USER'; payload: Partial<User> }
 13	 | { type: 'CLEAR_ERROR' };
 14	
 15	// Auth Context Type
 16	interface AuthContextType {
 17	 state: AuthState;
 18	 login: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;
 19	 register: (userData: RegisterData) => Promise<void>;
 20	 logout: () => Promise<void>;
 21	 updateUser: (userData: Partial<User>) => Promise<void>;
 22	 clearError: () => void;
 23	}
 24	
 25	// Register Data Type
 26	interface RegisterData {
 27	 email: string;
 28	 password: string;
 29	 name: string;
 30	 age: number;
 31	 bio?: string;
 32	 city?: string;
 33	 interests?: string[];
 34	}
 35	
 36	// Initial State
 37	const initialState: AuthState = {
 38	 user: null,
 39	 isAuthenticated: false,
 40	 isLoading: false,
 41	 error: null,
 42	};
 43	
 44	// Auth Reducer
 45	const authReducer = (state: AuthState, action: AuthAction): AuthState => {
 46	 switch (action.type) {
 47	 case 'AUTH_START':
 48	 return {
 49	 ...state,
 50	 isLoading: true,
 51	 error: null,
 52	 };
 53	 
 54	 case 'AUTH_SUCCESS':
 55	 return {
 56	 ...state,
 57	 user: action.payload,
 58	 isAuthenticated: true,
 59	 isLoading: false,
 60	 error: null,
 61	 };
 62	 
 63	 case 'AUTH_FAILURE':
 64	 return {
 65	 ...state,
 66	 user: null,
 67	 isAuthenticated: false,
 68	 isLoading: false,
 69	 error: action.payload,
 70	 };
 71	 
 72	 case 'LOGOUT':
 73	 return {
 74	 ...initialState,
 75	 };
 76	 
 77	 case 'UPDATE_USER':
 78	 return {
 79	 ...state,
 80	 user: state.user ? { ...state.user, ...action.payload } : null,
 81	 };
 82	 
 83	 case 'CLEAR_ERROR':
 84	 return {
 85	 ...state,
 86	 error: null,
 87	 };
 88	 
 89	 default:
 90	 return state;
 91	 }
 92	};
...
 110	
 111	 const checkAuthStatus = async () => {
 112	 try {
 113	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_START' });
 114	
 115	 // Check if we have a stored token
 116	 const token = await tokenManager.getToken();
 117	
 118	 if (!token) {
 119	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_FAILURE', payload: 'No stored authentication found' });
 120	 return;
 121	 }
 122	
 123	 // Validate token with backend by getting current user
 124	 const response = await authService.getCurrentUser();
 125	
 126	 if (response.data?.user) {
 127	 const user = mapApiUserToUser(response.data.user);
 128	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_SUCCESS', payload: user });
 129	 } else {
 130	 // Token is invalid, remove it
 131	 await tokenManager.removeToken();
 132	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_FAILURE', payload: response.error || 'Invalid token' });
 133	 }
...
 231	 } catch (error) {
 232	 const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Failed to update user';
 233	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_FAILURE', payload: errorMessage });
 234	 throw error;
 235	 }
 236	 };
 237	
 238	 const clearError = () => {
 239	 dispatch({ type: 'CLEAR_ERROR' });
 240	 };
 241	
 242	 const value: AuthContextType = {
 243	 state,
 244	 login,
 245	 register,
 246	 logout,
 247	 updateUser,
 248	 clearError,
 249	 };
 250	
 251	 return (
 252	 <AuthContext.Provider value={value}>
 253	 {children}
 254	 </AuthContext.Provider>
 255	 );
 256	};
 257	
 258	// Custom hook to use Auth Context
 259	export const useAuth = (): AuthContextType => {
 260	 const context = useContext(AuthContext);
 261	 if (context === undefined) {
 262	 throw new Error('useAuth must be used within an AuthProvider');
 263	 }
 264	 return context;
 265	};
 266	
 267	export default AuthContext;

","workspace_file_chunks":[]},{"status":"success","request_id":"4ce9d0a7-60ce-4aad-9716-1f55656bc6c9","request_message":"","structured_output_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":5,"content":"","tool_use":{"tool_use_id":"toolu_01RqRc1HGakesrvSGk3dxFhB","tool_name":"save-file","input_json":"{"instructions_reminder": "LIMIT THE FILE CONTENT TO AT MOST 300 LINES. IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "play_date/PlayDateApp/src/games/PuzzleConnect/PuzzleLogic.ts", "file_content": "import { PuzzleConnectData } from '../../types';\n\nexport interface PuzzleConfig {\n gridSize: number;\n difficulty: 'easy' | 'medium' | 'hard';\n patternType: 'sequence' | 'sudoku' | 'pattern' | 'math';\n}\n\nexport interface CellInfo {\n value: number;\n isVisible: boolean;\n isCorrect: boolean;\n confidence: number; // 0-1, how sure we are about this cell\n}\n\nexport class PuzzleGenerator {\n static generatePuzzle(config: PuzzleConfig): PuzzleConnectData {\n const { gridSize, difficulty, patternType } = config;\n \n let solution: number[][];\n \n switch (patternType) {\n case 'sequence':\n solution = this.generateSequencePuzzle(gridSize);\n break;\n case 'sudoku':\n solution = this.generateSudokuLikePuzzle(gridSize);\n break;\n case 'pattern':\n solution = this.generatePatternPuzzle(gridSize);\n break;\n case 'math':\n solution = this.generateMathPuzzle(gridSize);\n break;\n default:\n solution = this.generateSequencePuzzle(gridSize);\n }\n\n const { playerAView, playerBView } = this.createAsymmetricViews(\n solution, \n difficulty\n );\n\n return {\n gridSize,\n playerAView,\n playerBView,\n solution,\n cluesShared: [],\n };\n }\n\n private static generateSequencePuzzle(size: number): number[][] {\n const grid: number[][] = [];\n \n for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n grid[i] = [];\n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n // Create a sequence pattern: each row increases by 1, wrapping around\n grid[i][j] = ((i * size + j) % (size * size)) + 1;\n }\n }\n \n return grid;\n }\n\n private static generateSudokuLikePuzzle(size: number): number[][] {\n const grid: number[][] = [];\n \n // For 4x4 grid, use numbers 1-4 with no repeats in rows/columns\n for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n grid[i] = [];\n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n // Latin square pattern\n grid[i][j] = ((i + j) % size) + 1;\n }\n }\n \n return grid;\n }\n\n private static generatePatternPuzzle(size: number): number[][] {\n const grid: number[][] = [];\n \n for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n grid[i] = [];\n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n // Checkerboard-like pattern with mathematical relationship\n if ((i + j) % 2 === 0) {\n grid[i][j] = (i + 1);\n } else {\n grid[i][j] = (j + 1);\n }\n }\n }\n \n return grid;\n }\n\n private static generateMathPuzzle(size: number): number[][] {\n const grid: number[][] = [];\n \n for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n grid[i] = [];\n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n // Mathematical relationship: sum of coordinates + 1\n grid[i][j] = ((i + j) % size) + 1;\n }\n }\n \n return grid;\n }\n\n private static createAsymmetricViews(\n solution: number[][], \n difficulty: 'easy' | 'medium' | 'hard'\n ): { playerAView: number[][]; playerBView: number[][] } {\n const size = solution.length;\n const playerAView: number[][] = [];\n const playerBView: number[][] = [];\n\n // Determine visibility percentage based on difficulty\n const visibilityMap = {\n easy: 0.6, // 60% of cells visible to each player\n medium: 0.4, // 40% of cells visible to each player\n hard: 0.3, // 30% of cells visible to each player\n };\n\n const visibilityRate = visibilityMap[difficulty];\n\n for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n playerAView[i] = [];\n playerBView[i] = [];\n \n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n // Create complementary visibility patterns\n const cellIndex = i * size + j;\n const isPlayerAVisible = this.shouldCellBeVisible(i, j, 'A', visibilityRate);\n const isPlayerBVisible = this.shouldCellBeVisible(i, j, 'B', visibilityRate);\n\n // Ensure some overlap but mostly complementary information\n playerAView[i][j] = isPlayerAVisible ? solution[i][j] : 0;\n playerBView[i][j] = isPlayerBVisible ? solution[i][j] : 0;\n }\n }\n\n return { playerAView, playerBView };\n }\n\n private static shouldCellBeVisible(\n row: number, \n col: number, \n player: 'A' | 'B', \n visibilityRate: number\n ): boolean {\n // Create deterministic but seemingly random visibility pattern\n const seed = row * 7 + col * 11 + (player === 'A' ? 0 : 13);\n const pseudoRandom = (seed * 9301 + 49297) % 233280;\n const normalizedRandom = pseudoRandom / 233280;\n \n return normalizedRandom < visibilityRate;\n }\n}\n\nexport class PuzzleValidator {\n static validateMove(\n currentGrid: number[][],\n solution: number[][],\n row: number,\n col: number,\n value: number\n ): { isValid: boolean; isCorrect: boolean } {\n const isCorrect = solution[row][col] === value;\n const isValid = value >= 1 && value <= solution.length; // Valid range\n \n return { isValid, isCorrect };\n }\n\n static isPuzzleComplete(\n playerAView: number[][],\n playerBView: number[][],\n solution: number[][]\n ): boolean {\n const size = solution.length;\n \n for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n const correctValue = solution[i][j];\n const playerAValue = playerAView[i][j];\n const playerBValue = playerBView[i][j];\n \n // At least one player must have the correct value\n if (playerAValue !== correctValue && playerBValue !== correctValue) {\n return false;\n }\n }\n }\n \n return true;\n }\n\n static calculateCompletionPercentage(\n playerAView: number[][],\n playerBView: number[][],\n solution: number[][]\n ): number {\n const size = solution.length;\n let correctCells = 0;\n let totalCells = size * size;\n \n for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n const correctValue = solution[i][j];\n const playerAValue = playerAView[i][j];\n const playerBValue = playerBView[i][j];\n \n if (playerAValue === correctValue || playerBValue === correctValue) {\n correctCells++;\n }\n }\n }\n \n return (correctCells / totalCells) * 100;\n }\n\n static getHint(\n playerAView: number[][],\n playerBView: number[][],\n solution: number[][],\n playerRole: 'A' | 'B'\n ): string | null {\n const size = solution.length;\n const currentView = playerRole === 'A' ? playerAView : playerBView;\n const otherView = playerRole === 'A' ? playerBView : playerAView;\n \n // Find a cell where the other player has information but current player doesn't\n for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n if (currentView[i][j] === 0 && otherView[i][j] !== 0) {\n return `Your partner can see the value at row ${i + 1}, column ${j + 1}`;\n }\n }\n }\n \n // Find a pattern hint\n const patterns = this.detectPatterns(solution);\n if (patterns.length > 0) {\n return patterns[Math.floor(Math.random() * patterns.length)];\n }\n \n return null;\n }\n\n private static detectPatterns(solution: number[][]): string[] {\n const patterns: string[] = [];\n const size = solution.length;\n \n // Check for row patterns\n for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n if (this.isSequence(solution[i])) {\n patterns.push(`Row ${i + 1} follows a sequence pattern`);\n }\n }\n \n // Check for column patterns\n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n const column = solution.map(row => row[j]);\n if (this.isSequence(column)) {\n patterns.push(`Column ${j + 1} follows a sequence pattern`);\n }\n }\n \n return patterns;\n }\n\n private static isSequence(arr: number[]): boolean {\n if (arr.length < 2) return false;\n \n const diff = arr[1] - arr[0];\n for (let i = 2; i < arr.length; i++) {\n if (arr[i] - arr[i - 1] !== diff) {\n return false;\n }\n }\n \n return true;\n }\n}\n\nexport class PuzzleScorer {\n static calculateScore(\n timeRemaining: number,\n totalTime: number,\n hintsUsed: number,\n completionPercentage: number\n ): number {\n const timeBonus = (timeRemaining / totalTime) * 500;\n const completionBonus = (completionPercentage / 100) * 300;\n const hintPenalty = hintsUsed * 50;\n \n return Math.max(0, Math.round(timeBonus + completionBonus - hintPenalty));\n }\n\n static getPerformanceRating(score: number): string {\n if (score >= 700) return 'Excellent';\n if (score >= 500) return 'Great';\n if (score >= 300) return 'Good';\n if (score >= 100) return 'Fair';\n return 'Keep Trying';\n }\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a more sophisticated puzzle generation system with better logic:

i < size; i++) {\n grid[i] = [];\n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n // Simple pattern: alternating numbers based on position\n grid[i][j] = ((i + j) % 4) + 1;\n }\n }\n \n return grid;\n}\n\nfunction createPlayerView(solution: number[][], player: 'A' | 'B'): number[][] {\n const size = solution.length;\n const view: number[][] = [];\n \n for (let i = 0; i < size; i++) {\n view[i] = [];\n for (let j = 0; j < size; j++) {\n // Player A sees some cells, Player B sees different cells\n const shouldShow = player === 'A' \n ? (i + j) % 3 === 0 // Player A sees every 3rd cell in a pattern\n : (i + j) % 3 === 1; // Player B sees different cells\n \n view[i][j] = shouldShow ? solution[i][j] : 0; // 0 means empty\n }\n }\n \n return view;\n}\n\nfunction isPuzzleComplete(gameData: PuzzleConnectData): boolean {\n const { playerAView, playerBView, solution } = gameData;\n \n for (let i = 0; i < solution.length; i++) {\n for (let j = 0; j < solution[i].length; j++) {\n const playerAValue = playerAView[i][j];\n const playerBValue = playerBView[i][j];\n const correctValue = solution[i][j];\n \n // Check if either player has the correct value in this cell\n if (playerAValue !== correctValue && playerBValue !== correctValue) {\n return false;\n }\n }\n }\n \n return true;\n}\n\nfunction calculateScore(timeRemaining: number): number {\n // Score based on time remaining (max 1000 points)\n return Math.round((timeRemaining / GAME_DURATION) * 1000);\n}", "old_str_start_line_number": 189, "old_str_end_line_number": 251, "new_str": "// Helper functions\nfunction generateInitialGameData(): PuzzleConnectData {\n return PuzzleGenerator.generatePuzzle({\n gridSize: GRID_SIZE,\n difficulty: 'medium',\n patternType: 'sequence',\n });\n}"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":""},{"id":3,"type":2,"content":""},{"id":4,"type":3,"content":""}],"seen_state":"seen","structured_request_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":1,"tool_result_node":{"content":"Successfully edited the file play_date/PlayDateApp/src/games/PuzzleConnect/PuzzleConnectGame.tsx.

"file_content": "import React, { createContext, useContext, useReducer, useEffect, ReactNode } from 'react';\nimport { PuzzleConnectData, GameSession } from '../../types';\nimport { PuzzleGenerator, PuzzleValidator, PuzzleScorer } from './PuzzleLogic';\n\n// Game State Types\ninterface PuzzleGameState {\n gameData: PuzzleConnectData;\n timeRemaining: number;\n isGameActive: boolean;\n selectedCell: { row: number; col: number } | null;\n hintsUsed: number;\n score: number;\n completionPercentage: number;\n isLoading: boolean;\n error: string | null;\n}\n\n// Game Actions\ntype PuzzleGameAction =\n | { type: 'INITIALIZE_GAME'; payload: { gameData: PuzzleConnectData; duration: number } }\n | { type: 'UPDATE_GAME_DATA'; payload: PuzzleConnectData }\n | { type: 'SELECT_CELL'; payload: { row: number; col: number } | null }\n | { type: 'PLACE_NUMBER'; payload: { row: number; col: number; number: number; isPlayerA: boolean } }\n | { type: 'ADD_CLUE'; payload: string }\n | { type: 'USE_HINT' }\n | { type: 'TICK_TIMER' }\n | { type: 'END_GAME'; payload: { success: boolean; finalScore: number } }\n | { type: 'SET_ERROR'; payload: string }\n | { type: 'CLEAR_ERROR' };\n\n// Context Type\ninterface PuzzleGameContextType {\n state: PuzzleGameState;\n actions: {\n initializeGame: (gameSession: GameSession, duration: number) => void;\n selectCell: (row: number, col: number) => void;\n placeNumber: (number: number, isPlayerA: boolean) => void;\n shareClue: (clue: string) => void;\n useHint: () => string | null;\n endGame: (success: boolean) => void;\n clearError: () => void;\n };\n}\n\n// Initial State\nconst initialState: PuzzleGameState = {\n gameData: {\n gridSize: 4,\n playerAView: [],\n playerBView: [],\n solution: [],\n cluesShared: [],\n },\n timeRemaining: 180,\n isGameActive: false,\n selectedCell: null,\n hintsUsed: 0,\n score: 0,\n completionPercentage: 0,\n isLoading: false,\n error: null,\n};\n\n// Reducer\nconst puzzleGameReducer = (state: PuzzleGameState, action: PuzzleGameAction): PuzzleGameState => {\n switch (action.type) {\n case 'INITIALIZE_GAME':\n return {\n ...state,\n gameData: action.payload.gameData,\n timeRemaining: action.payload.duration,\n isGameActive: true,\n selectedCell: null,\n hintsUsed: 0,\n score: 0,\n completionPercentage: 0,\n isLoading: false,\n error: null,\n };\n\n case 'UPDATE_GAME_DATA':\n const newCompletionPercentage = PuzzleValidator.calculateCompletionPercentage(\n action.payload.playerAView,\n action.payload.playerBView,\n action.payload.solution\n );\n \n return {\n ...state,\n gameData: action.payload,\n completionPercentage: newCompletionPercentage,\n };\n\n case 'SELECT_CELL':\n return {\n ...state,\n selectedCell: action.payload,\n };\n\n case 'PLACE_NUMBER':\n const { row, col, number, isPlayerA } = action.payload;\n const newGameData = { ...state.gameData };\n \n if (isPlayerA) {\n newGameData.playerAView = [...state.gameData.playerAView];\n newGameData.playerAView[row] = [...newGameData.playerAView[row]];\n newGameData.playerAView[row][col] = number;\n } else {\n newGameData.playerBView = [...state.gameData.playerBView];\n newGameData.playerBView[row] = [...newGameData.playerBView[row]];\n newGameData.playerBView[row][col] = number;\n }\n\n const updatedCompletionPercentage = PuzzleValidator.calculateCompletionPercentage(\n newGameData.playerAView,\n newGameData.playerBView,\n newGameData.solution\n );\n\n return {\n ...state,\n gameData: newGameData,\n selectedCell: null,\n completionPercentage: updatedCompletionPercentage,\n };\n\n case 'ADD_CLUE':\n return {\n ...state,\n gameData: {\n ...state.gameData,\n cluesShared: [...state.gameData.cluesShared, action.payload],\n },\n };\n\n case 'USE_HINT':\n return {\n ...state,\n hintsUsed: state.hintsUsed + 1,\n };\n\n case 'TICK_TIMER':\n const newTimeRemaining = Math.max(0, state.timeRemaining - 1);\n return {\n ...state,\n timeRemaining: newTimeRemaining,\n isGameActive: newTimeRemaining > 0 && state.isGameActive,\n };\n\n case 'END_GAME':\n return {\n ...state,\n isGameActive: false,\n score: action.payload.finalScore,\n };\n\n case 'SET_ERROR':\n return {\n ...state,\n error: action.payload,\n isLoading: false,\n };\n\n case 'CLEAR_ERROR':\n return {\n ...state,\n error: null,\n };\n\n default:\n return state;\n }\n};\n\n// Context\nconst PuzzleGameContext = createContext<PuzzleGameContextType | undefined>(undefined);\n\n// Provider Component\ninterface PuzzleGameProviderProps {\n children: ReactNode;\n onGameUpdate?: (gameData: PuzzleConnectData) => void;\n onGameComplete?: (success: boolean, score: number) => void;\n}\n\nexport const PuzzleGameProvider: React.FC<PuzzleGameProviderProps> = ({\n children,\n onGameUpdate,\n onGameComplete,\n}) => {\n const [state, dispatch] = useReducer(puzzleGameReducer, initialState);\n\n // Timer effect\n useEffect(() => {\n if (!state.isGameActive || state.timeRemaining <= 0) return;\n\n const timer = setInterval(() => {\n dispatch({ type: 'TICK_TIMER' });\n }, 1000);\n\n return () => clearInterval(timer);\n }, [state.isGameActive, state.timeRemaining]);\n\n // Check for game completion\n useEffect(() => {\n if (state.isGameActive && state.gameData.solution.length > 0) {\n const isComplete = PuzzleValidator.isPuzzleComplete(\n state.gameData.playerAView,\n state.gameData.playerBView,\n state.gameData.solution\n );\n\n if (isComplete) {\n const finalScore = PuzzleScorer.calculateScore(\n state.timeRemaining,\n 180, // total time\n state.hintsUsed,\n state.completionPercentage\n );\n \n dispatch({ type: 'END_GAME', payload: { success: true, finalScore } });\n onGameComplete?.(true, finalScore);\n }\n }\n }, [state.gameData, state.isGameActive, state.timeRemaining, state.hintsUsed, state.completionPercentage, onGameComplete]);\n\n // Time up effect\n useEffect(() => {\n if (state.timeRemaining === 0 && state.isGameActive) {\n dispatch({ type: 'END_GAME', payload: { success: false, finalScore: 0 } });\n onGameComplete?.(false, 0);\n }\n }, [state.timeRemaining, state.isGameActive, onGameComplete]);\n\n // Game data update effect\n useEffect(() => {\n if (onGameUpdate) {\n onGameUpdate(state.gameData);\n }\n }, [state.gameData, onGameUpdate]);\n\n const actions = {\n initializeGame: (gameSession: GameSession, duration: number) => {\n const gameData = gameSession.gameData || PuzzleGenerator.generatePuzzle({\n gridSize: 4,\n difficulty: 'medium',\n patternType: 'sequence',\n });\n \n dispatch({ \n type: 'INITIALIZE_GAME', \n payload: { gameData, duration } \n });\n },\n\n selectCell: (row: number, col: number) => {\n dispatch({ \n type: 'SELECT_CELL', \n payload: { row, col } \n });\n },\n\n placeNumber: (number: number, isPlayerA: boolean) => {\n if (!state.selectedCell) return;\n \n const { row, col } = PuzzleScorer.calculateScore(\n state.timeRemaining,\n 180,\n state.hintsUsed,\n state.completionPercentage\n ) : 0;\n\n dispatch({ type: 'END_GAME', payload: { success, finalScore } });\n },\n\n clearError: () => {\n dispatch({ type: 'CLEAR_ERROR' });\n },\n };\n\n const value: PuzzleGameContextType = {\n state,\n actions,\n };\n\n return (\n <PuzzleGameContext.Provider value={value}>\n {children}\n </PuzzleGameContext.Provider>\n );\n};\n\n// Custom Hook\nexport const usePuzzleGame = (): PuzzleGameContextType => {\n const context = useContext(PuzzleGameContext);\n if (context === undefined) {\n throw new Error('usePuzzleGame must be used within a PuzzleGameProvider');\n }\n return context;\n};\n\nexport default PuzzleGameContext;"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a game context for managing the puzzle game state:

"file_content": "import { useCallback, useEffect, useState } from 'react';\nimport { Alert } from 'react-native';\nimport { GameSession, PuzzleConnectData } from '../../types';\nimport { PuzzleGenerator, PuzzleValidator, PuzzleScorer } from './PuzzleLogic';\n\ninterface UsePuzzleConnectProps {\n gameSession: GameSession;\n currentUserId: string;\n onGameUpdate: (gameData: PuzzleConnectData) => void;\n onGameComplete: (success: boolean, score: number) => void;\n}\n\ninterface UsePuzzleConnectReturn {\n gameData: PuzzleConnectData;\n timeRemaining: number;\n isGameActive: boolean;\n selectedCell: { row: number; col: number } | null;\n hintsUsed: number;\n completionPercentage: number;\n isPlayerA: boolean;\n playerView: number[][];\n \n // Actions\n handleCellPress: (row: number, col: number) => void;\n handleNumberSelect: (number: number) => void;\n handleClueShare: (clue: string) => void;\n handleGetHint: () => void;\n formatTime: (seconds: number) => string;\n}\n\nexport const usePuzzleConnect = ({\n gameSession,\n currentUserId,\n onGameUpdate,\n onGameComplete,\n}: UsePuzzleConnectProps): UsePuzzleConnectReturn => {\n // Initialize game data\n const [gameData, setGameData] = useState<PuzzleConnectData>(() => {\n return gameSession.gameData || PuzzleGenerator.generatePuzzle({\n gridSize: 4,\n difficulty: 'medium',\n patternType: 'sequence',\n });\n });\n\n const [timeRemaining, setTimeRemaining] = useState(180); // 3 minutes\n const [isGameActive, setIsGameActive] = useState(true);\n const [selectedCell, setSelectedCell] = useState<{ row: number; col: number } | null>(null);\n const [hintsUsed, setHintsUsed] = useState(0);\n\n // Determine player role\n const isPlayerA = gameSession.players[0] === currentUserId;\n const playerView = isPlayerA ? gameData.playerAView : gameData.playerBView;\n\n // Calculate completion percentage\n const completionPercentage = PuzzleValidator.calculateCompletionPercentage(\n gameData.playerAView,\n gameData.playerBView,\n gameData.solution\n );\n\n // Timer effect\n useEffect(() => {\n if (!isGameActive || timeRemaining <= 0) return;\n\n const timer = setInterval(() => {\n setTimeRemaining((prev) => {\n if (prev <= 1) {\n setIsGameActive(false);\n onGameComplete(false, 0);\n return 0;\n }\n return prev - 1;\n });\n }, 1000);\n\n return () => clearInterval(timer);\n }, [isGameActive, timeRemaining, onGameComplete]);\n\n // Check for puzzle completion\n useEffect(() => {\n if (isGameActive && PuzzleValidator.isPuzzleComplete(\n gameData.playerAView, \n gameData.playerBView, \n gameData.solution\n )) {\n setIsGameActive(false);\n const score = PuzzleScorer.calculateScore(\n timeRemaining, \n 180, \n hintsUsed, \n completionPercentage\n );\n onGameComplete(true, score);\n }\n }, [gameData, timeRemaining, hintsUsed, completionPercentage, isGameActive, onGameComplete]);\n\n // Handle cell selection\n const handleCellPress = useCallback((row: number, col: number) => {\n if (!isGameActive) return;\n setSelectedCell({ row, col });\n }, [isGameActive]);\n\n // Handle number placement\n const handleNumberSelect = useCallback((number: number) => {\n if (!selectedCell || !isGameActive) return;\n\n const { row, col } = selectedCell;\n \n // Validate the move\n const validation = PuzzleValidator.validateMove(\n playerView,\n gameData.solution,\n row,\n col,\n number\n );\n\n if (!validation.isValid) {\n Alert.alert('Invalid Move', 'Please select a valid number (1-4).');\n return;\n }\n\n // Create updated game data\n const newGameData = { ...gameData };\n \n if (isPlayerA) {\n newGameData.playerAView = [...gameData.playerAView];\n newGameData.playerAView[row] = [...newGameData.playerAView[row]];\n newGameData.playerAView[row][col] = number;\n } else {\n newGameData.playerBView = [...gameData.playerBView];\n newGameData.playerBView[row] = [...newGameData.playerBView[row]];\n newGameData.playerBView[row][col] = number;\n }\n\n // Update state\n setGameData(newGameData);\n setSelectedCell(null);\n onGameUpdate(newGameData);\n\n // Show feedback for correct/incorrect moves\n if (validation.isCorrect) {\n // Could add a subtle success animation or sound here\n } else {\n // Could add a subtle error indication\n }\n }, [selectedCell, isGameActive, gameData, isPlayerA, playerView, onGameUpdate]);\n\n // Handle clue sharing\n const handleClueShare = useCallback((clue: string) => {\n if (!isGameActive) return;\n\n const playerRole = isPlayerA ? 'A' : 'B';\n const clueWithRole = `Player ${playerRole}: ${clue}`;\n \n const newGameData = {\n ...gameData,\n cluesShared: [...gameData.cluesShared, clueWithRole],\n };\n\n setGameData(newGameData);\n onGameUpdate(newGameData);\n }, [gameData, isGameActive, isPlayerA, onGameUpdate]);\n\n // Handle hint request\n const handleGetHint = useCallback(() => {\n if (!isGameActive) return;\n\n const hint = PuzzleValidator.getHint(\n gameData.playerAView,\n gameData.playerBView,\n gameData.solution,\n isPlayerA ? 'A' : 'B'\n );\n\n if (hint) {\n setHintsUsed(prev => prev + 1);\n Alert.alert('\ud83d\udca1 Hint', hint, [\n { text: 'Got it!', style: 'default' }\n ]);\n } else {\n Alert.alert('No Hints Available', 'Keep working with your partner to solve the puzzle!', [\n { text: 'OK', style: 'default' }\n ]);\n }\n }, [gameData, isPlayerA, isGameActive]);\n\n // Format time display\n const formatTime = useCallback((seconds: number): string => {\n const mins = Math.floor(seconds / 60);\n const secs = seconds % 60;\n return `${mins}:${secs.toString().padStart(2, '0')}`;\n }, []);\n\n // Sync external game data updates\n useEffect(() => {\n if (gameSession.gameData && gameSession.gameData !== gameData) {\n setGameData(gameSession.gameData);\n }\n }, [gameSession.gameData, gameData]);\n\n return {\n gameData,\n timeRemaining,\n isGameActive,\n selectedCell,\n hintsUsed,\n completionPercentage,\n isPlayerA,\n playerView,\n \n // Actions\n handleCellPress,\n handleNumberSelect,\n handleClueShare,\n handleGetHint,\n formatTime,\n };\n};\n\nexport default usePuzzleConnect;"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a custom hook for easier game management:

Animated.Value(0)).current;\n const correctScale = useRef(new Animated.Value(1)).current;\n const incorrectShake = useRef(new Animated.Value(0)).current;\n const progressWidth = useRef(new Animated.timing(successOpacity, {\n toValue: 0,\n duration: 300,\n useNativeDriver: true,\n }),\n ]),\n ]).start(() => {\n onAnimationComplete?.();\n });\n }\n }, [showSuccess, successScale, successOpacity, onAnimationComplete]);\n\n // Correct placement animation\n useEffect(() => {\n if (showCorrectPlacement) {\n Animated.sequence([\n Animated.spring(correctScale, {\n toValue: 1.2,\n tension: 300,\n friction: 10,\n useNativeDriver: true,\n }),\n Animated.spring(correctScale, {\n toValue: 1,\n tension: 300,\n friction: 10,\n useNativeDriver: true,\n }),\n ]).start();\n }\n }, [showCorrectPlacement, correctScale]);\n\n // Incorrect placement animation\n useEffect(() => {\n if (showIncorrectPlacement) {\n Animated.sequence([\n Animated.timing(incorrectShake, {\n toValue: "file_content": "import React, { useRef, useState, useCallback, useEffect } from 'react';\nimport {\n View,\n PanGestureHandler,\n PanGestureHandlerGestureEvent,\n State,\n} from 'react-native-gesture-handler';\nimport {\n Canvas,\n Path,\n Skia,\n useCanvasRef,\n useTouchHandler,\n} from '@shopify/react-native-skia';\nimport {\n StyleSheet,\n Dimensions,\n TouchableOpacity,\n Text,\n View as RNView,\n} from 'react-native';\nimport { extendedTheme } from '../../utils/theme';\nimport { DrawingStroke } from '../../types';\n\ninterface DrawingCanvasProps {\n strokes: DrawingStroke[];\n onStrokeAdd: (stroke: DrawingStroke) => void;\n isDrawingEnabled: boolean;\n canvasWidth?: number;\n canvasHeight?: number;\n selectedColor?: string;\n selectedWidth?: number;\n}\n\nconst { width: screenWidth } = Dimensions.get('window');\nconst DEFAULT_CANVAS_WIDTH = screenWidth - (extendedTheme.spacing.lg * 2);\nconst DEFAULT_CANVAS_HEIGHT = 300;\n\nconst COLORS = [\n '#000000', // Black\n '#FF6B6B', // Red\n '#4ECDC4', // Teal\n '#45B7D1', // Blue\n '#96CEB4', // Green\n '#FFEAA7', // Yellow\n '#DDA0DD', // Purple\n '#FFA07A', // Orange\n];\n\nconst BRUSH_SIZES = [2, 4, 6, 8, 12];\n\nconst DrawingCanvas: React.FC<DrawingCanvasProps> = ({\n strokes,\n onStrokeAdd,\n isDrawingEnabled,\n canvasWidth = DEFAULT_CANVAS_WIDTH,\n canvasHeight = DEFAULT_CANVAS_HEIGHT,\n selectedColor = '#000000',\n selectedWidth = 4,\n}) => {\n const canvasRef = useCanvasRef();\n const [currentPath, setCurrentPath] = useState<string>('');\n const [currentStroke, setCurrentStroke] = useState<DrawingStroke | null>(null);\n const [activeColor, setActiveColor] = useState(selectedColor);\n const [activeBrushSize, setActiveBrushSize] = useState(selectedWidth);\n\n // Convert strokes to Skia paths\n const createPathFromStroke = useCallback((stroke: DrawingStroke): string => {\n if (stroke.points.length === 0) return '';\n \n let pathString = `M${stroke.points[0].x},${stroke.points[0].y}`;\n \n for (let i = 1; i < stroke.points.length; i++) {\n const point = stroke.points[i];\n pathString += ` L${point.x},${point.y}`;\n }\n \n return pathString;\n }, []);\n\n // Touch handler for drawing\n const touchHandler = useTouchHandler({\n onStart: (touchInfo) => {\n if (!isDrawingEnabled) return;\n \n const { x, y } = touchInfo;\n const newStroke: DrawingStroke = {\n points: [{ x, y }],\n color: activeColor,\n width: activeBrushSize,\n timestamp: Date.now(),\n };\n \n setCurrentStroke(newStroke);\n setCurrentPath(`M${x},${y}`);\n },\n \n onActive: (touchInfo) => {\n if (!isDrawingEnabled || !currentStroke) return;\n \n const { x, y } = touchInfo;\n const updatedStroke = {\n ...currentStroke,\n points: [...currentStroke.points, { x, y }],\n };\n \n setCurrentStroke(updatedStroke);\n setCurrentPath(prev => `${prev} L${x},${y}`);\n },\n \n onEnd: () => {\n if (!isDrawingEnabled || !currentStroke) return;\n \n // Add the completed stroke\n onStrokeAdd(currentStroke);\n \n // Reset current drawing state\n setCurrentStroke(null);\n setCurrentPath('');\n },\n });\n\n // Clear canvas function\n const clearCanvas = useCallback(() => {\n if (!isDrawingEnabled) return;\n \n // This would typically send a clear command to other players\n // For now, we'll just reset local state\n setCurrentStroke(null);\n setCurrentPath('');\n }, [isDrawingEnabled]);\n\n return (\n <RNView style={styles.container}>\n {/* Drawing Tools */}\n {isDrawingEnabled && (\n <RNView style={styles.toolsContainer}>\n {/* Color Palette */}\n <RNView style={styles.colorPalette}>\n {COLORS.map((color) => (\n <TouchableOpacity\n key={color}\n style={[\n styles.colorButton,\n { backgroundColor: color },\n activeColor === color && styles.activeColorButton,\n ]}\n onPress={() => setActiveColor(color)}\n />\n ))}\n </RNView>\n \n {/* Brush Sizes */}\n <RNView style={styles.brushSizes}>\n {BRUSH_SIZES.map((size) => (\n <TouchableOpacity\n key={size}\n style={[\n styles.brushButton,\n activeBrushSize === size && styles.activeBrushButton,\n ]}\n onPress={() => setActiveBrushSize(size)}\n >\n <RNView\n style={[\n styles.brushPreview,\n {\n width: size + 4,\n height: size + 4,\n borderRadius: (size + 4) / 2,\n backgroundColor: activeColor,\n },\n ]}\n />\n </TouchableOpacity>\n ))}\n </RNView>\n \n {/* Clear Button */}\n <TouchableOpacity style={styles.clearButton} onPress={clearCanvas}>\n <Text style={styles.clearButtonText}>Clear</Text>\n </TouchableOpacity>\n </RNView>\n )}\n\n {/* Canvas */}\n <RNView style={[styles.canvasContainer, { width: canvasWidth, height: canvasHeight }]}>\n <Canvas\n ref={canvasRef}\n style={{ width: canvasWidth, height: canvasHeight }}\n onTouch={touchHandler}\n >\n {/* Render existing strokes */}\n {strokes.map((stroke, index) => {\n const pathString = createPathFromStroke(stroke);\n if (!pathString) return null;\n \n const path = Skia.Path.MakeFromSVGString(pathString);\n if (!path) return null;\n \n return (\n <Path\n key={`stroke-${index}-${stroke.timestamp}`}\n path={path}\n color={stroke.color}\n style=\"stroke\"\n strokeWidth={stroke.width}\n strokeCap=\"round\"\n strokeJoin=\"round\"\n />\n );\n })}\n \n {/* Render current stroke being drawn */}\n {currentPath && currentStroke && (\n <Path\n path={Skia.Path.MakeFromSVGString(currentPath)!}\n color={currentStroke.color}\n style=\"stroke\"\n strokeWidth={currentStroke.width}\n strokeCap=\"round\"\n strokeJoin=\"round\"\n />\n )}\n </Canvas>\n \n {/* Overlay for disabled state */}\n {!isDrawingEnabled && (\n <RNView style={styles.disabledOverlay}>\n <Text style={styles.disabledText}>\n {strokes.length === 0 ? 'Waiting for drawing...' : 'Watch and guess!'}\n </Text>\n </RNView>\n )}\n </RNView>\n </RNView>\n );\n};\n\nconst styles = StyleSheet.create({\n container: {\n alignItems: 'center',\n },\n toolsContainer: {\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.surface,\n borderRadius: extendedTheme.borderRadius.lg,\n padding: extendedTheme.spacing.sm,\n marginBottom: extendedTheme.spacing.md,\n ...extendedTheme.shadows.sm,\n },\n colorPalette: {\n flexDirection: 'row',\n marginBottom: extendedTheme.spacing.sm,\n },\n colorButton: {\n width: 30,\n height: 30,\n borderRadius: 15,\n marginRight: extendedTheme.spacing.xs,\n borderWidth: 2,\n borderColor: 'transparent',\n },\n activeColorButton: {\n borderColor: extendedTheme.colors.primary,\n borderWidth: 3,\n },\n brushSizes: {\n flexDirection: 'row',\n alignItems: 'center',\n marginBottom: extendedTheme.spacing.sm,\n },\n brushButton: {\n width: 40,\n height: 40,\n borderRadius: 20,\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.background,\n justifyContent: 'center',\n alignItems: 'center',\n marginRight: extendedTheme.spacing.xs,\n borderWidth: 2,\n borderColor: 'transparent',\n },\n activeBrushButton: {\n borderColor: extendedTheme.colors.primary,\n },\n brushPreview: {\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.text,\n },\n clearButton: {\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.error,\n paddingHorizontal: extendedTheme.spacing.md,\n paddingVertical: extendedTheme.spacing.sm,\n borderRadius: extendedTheme.borderRadius.md,\n alignSelf: 'center',\n },\n clearButtonText: {\n ...extendedTheme.typography.button,\n color: extendedTheme.colors.background,\n fontSize: 14,\n },\n canvasContainer: {\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.background,\n borderRadius: extendedTheme.borderRadius.lg,\n borderWidth: 2,\n borderColor: extendedTheme.colors.border,\n overflow: 'hidden',\n position: 'relative',\n },\n disabledOverlay: {\n position: 'absolute',\n top: 0,\n left: 0,\n right: 0,\n bottom: 0,\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.overlay,\n justifyContent: 'center',\n alignItems: 'center',\n },\n disabledText: {\n ...extendedTheme.typography.body,\n color: extendedTheme.colors.background,\n textAlign: 'center',\n },\n});\n\nexport default style={styles.clearButtonText}>Clear</Text>\n </TouchableOpacity>\n </View>\n )}\n\n {/* Canvas */}\n <View \n style={[styles.canvasContainer, { width: canvasWidth, height: canvasHeight }]}\n {...panResponder.panHandlers}\n >\n <Svg width={canvasWidth} height={canvasHeight} style={styles.svg}>\n <G>\n {/* Render existing strokes */}\n {strokes.map((stroke, index) => {\n const pathString = strokeWidth={stroke.width}\n strokeLinecap=\"round\"\n strokeLinejoin=\"round\"\n fill=\"none\"\n />\n );\n })}\n \n {/* Render current stroke being drawn */}\n {currentPath && currentStroke && (\n <Path\n d={currentPath}\n stroke={currentStroke.color}\n strokeWidth={currentStroke.width}\n strokeLinecap=\"round\"\n strokeLinejoin=\"round\"\n fill=\"none\"\n />\n )}\n </G>\n </Svg>\n \n {/* "file_content": "import React, { useState, useRef, useEffect } from 'react';\nimport {\n View,\n Text,\n TextInput,\n TouchableOpacity,\n ScrollView,\n StyleSheet,\n KeyboardAvoidingView,\n Platform,\n Animated,\n} from 'react-native';\nimport { extendedTheme } from '../../utils/theme';\n\ninterface GuessingInterfaceProps {\n guesses: string[];\n onGuessSubmit: (guess: string) => void;\n isGuessingEnabled: boolean;\n currentPrompt?: string;\n isCorrectGuess?: boolean;\n timeRemaining?: number;\n showPromptToDrawer?: boolean;\n}\n\nconst GuessingInterface: React.FC<GuessingInterfaceProps> = ({\n guesses,\n onGuessSubmit,\n isGuessingEnabled,\n currentPrompt,\n isCorrectGuess,\n timeRemaining,\n showPromptToDrawer = false,\n}) => {\n const [currentGuess, setCurrentGuess] = useState('');\n const [isSubmitting, setIsSubmitting] = useState(false);\n const scrollViewRef = useRef<ScrollView>(null);\n const shakeAnimation = useRef(new Animated.Value(0)).current;\n const successAnimation = useRef(new Animated.Value(0)).current;\n\n // Auto-scroll to bottom when new guesses are added\n useEffect(() => {\n if (guesses.length > 0) {\n setTimeout(() => {\n scrollViewRef.current?.scrollToEnd({ animated: true });\n }, 100);\n }\n }, [guesses]);\n\n // Trigger success animation when correct guess is made\n useEffect(() => {\n if (isCorrectGuess) {\n Animated.sequence([\n Animated.spring(successAnimation, {\n toValue: 1,\n tension: 100,\n friction: 8,\n useNativeDriver: true,\n }),\n Animated.delay(2000),\n Animated.spring(successAnimation, {\n toValue: 0,\n tension: 100,\n friction: 8,\n useNativeDriver: true,\n }),\n ]).start();\n }\n }, [isCorrectGuess, successAnimation]);\n\n const handleSubmitGuess = async () => {\n const trimmedGuess = currentGuess.trim();\n if (!trimmedGuess || !isGuessingEnabled || isSubmitting) return;\n\n setIsSubmitting(true);\n \n try {\n await onGuessSubmit(trimmedGuess);\n setCurrentGuess('');\n } catch (error) {\n // Trigger shake animation on error\n Animated.sequence([\n Animated.timing(shakeAnimation, {\n toValue: 10,\n duration: 50,\n useNativeDriver: true,\n }),\n Animated.timing(shakeAnimation, {\n toValue: -10,\n duration: 50,\n useNativeDriver: true,\n }),\n Animated.timing(shakeAnimation, {\n toValue: 10,\n duration: 50,\n useNativeDriver: true,\n }),\n Animated.timing(shakeAnimation, {\n toValue: 0,\n duration: 50,\n useNativeDriver: true,\n }),\n ]).start();\n } finally {\n setIsSubmitting(false);\n }\n };\n\n const formatTime = (seconds?: number): string => {\n if (seconds === undefined) return '';\n const mins = Math.floor(seconds / 60);\n const secs = seconds % 60;\n return `${mins}:${secs.toString().padStart(2, '0')}`;\n };\n\n const getGuessStyle = (guess: string, index: number) => {\n const isLastGuess = index === guesses.length - 1;\n const isCorrect = isCorrectGuess && isLastGuess;\n \n return [\n styles.guessItem,\n isCorrect && styles.correctGuessItem,\n isLastGuess && styles.latestGuessItem,\n ];\n };\n\n const getGuessTextStyle = (guess: string, index: number) => {\n const isLastGuess = index === guesses.length - 1;\n const isCorrect = isCorrectGuess && isLastGuess;\n \n return [\n styles.guessText,\n isCorrect && styles.correctGuessText,\n ];\n };\n\n return (\n <KeyboardAvoidingView\n behavior={Platform.OS === 'ios' ? 'padding' : 'height'}\n style={styles.container}\n >\n {/* Header */}\n <View style={styles.header}>\n <View style={styles.headerLeft}>\n <Text style={styles.headerTitle}>\n {showPromptToDrawer ? 'Draw This!' : 'Guess the Drawing'}\n </Text>\n {showPromptToDrawer && currentPrompt && (\n <Text style={styles.promptText}>{currentPrompt}</Text>\n )}\n </View>\n {timeRemaining !== undefined && (\n <View style={styles.timerContainer}>\n <Text style={[\n styles.timerText,\n timeRemaining < 30 && styles.timerWarning\n ]}>\n {formatTime(timeRemaining)}\n </Text>\n </View>\n )}\n </View>\n\n {/* Guesses List */}\n <View style={styles.guessesContainer}>\n <ScrollView\n ref={scrollViewRef}\n style={styles.guessesList}\n showsVerticalScrollIndicator={false}\n contentContainerStyle={styles.guessesContent}\n >\n {guesses.length === 0 ? (\n <Text style={styles.noGuessesText}>\n {isGuessingEnabled \n ? 'Start guessing what\\'s being drawn!' \n : 'Waiting for guesses...'}\n </Text>\n ) : (\n guesses.map((guess, index) => (\n <Animated.View\n key={`guess-${index}`}\n style={getGuessStyle(guess, index)}\n >\n <Text style={getGuessTextStyle(guess, index)}>\n {guess}\n </Text>\n <Text style={styles.guessTime}>\n {new Date().toLocaleTimeString([], { \n hour: '2-digit', \n minute: '2-digit' \n })}\n </Text>\n </Animated.View>\n ))\n )}\n </ScrollView>\n </View>\n\n {/* Input Area */}\n {isGuessingEnabled && !isCorrectGuess && (\n <Animated.View \n style={[\n styles.inputContainer,\n { transform: [{ translateX: shakeAnimation }] }\n ]}\n >\n <TextInput\n style={styles.textInput}\n value={currentGuess}\n onChangeText={setCurrentGuess}\n placeholder=\"Type your guess...\"\n placeholderTextColor={extendedTheme.colors.textLight}\n maxLength={50}\n returnKeyType=\"send\"\n onSubmitEditing={handleSubmitGuess}\n editable={!isSubmitting}\n />\n <TouchableOpacity\n style={[\n styles.submitButton,\n (!currentGuess.trim() || isSubmitting) && styles.submitButtonDisabled\n ]}\n onPress={handleSubmitGuess}\n disabled={!currentGuess.trim() || isSubmitting}\n >\n <Text style={[\n styles.submitButtonText,\n (!currentGuess.trim() || isSubmitting) && styles.submitButtonTextDisabled\n ]}>\n {isSubmitting ? '...' : 'Guess'}\n </Text>\n </TouchableOpacity>\n </Animated.View>\n )}\n\n {/* Success Overlay */}\n {isCorrectGuess && (\n <Animated.View\n style={[\n styles.successOverlay,\n {\n opacity: successAnimation,\n transform: [{\n scale: successAnimation.interpolate({\n inputRange: [0, 1],\n outputRange: [0.8, 1],\n }),\n }],\n },\n ]}\n >\n <Text style={styles.successTitle}>\ud83c\udf89 Correct! \ud83c\udf89</Text>\n <Text style={styles.successSubtitle}>Great guess!</Text>\n </Animated.View>\n )}\n </KeyboardAvoidingView>\n );\n};\n\nconst styles = StyleSheet.create({\n container: {\n flex: 1,\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.surface,\n },\n header: {\n flexDirection: 'row',\n justifyContent: 'space-between',\n alignItems: 'center',\n paddingHorizontal: extendedTheme.spacing.lg,\n paddingVertical: extendedTheme.spacing.md,\n borderBottomWidth: 1,\n borderBottomColor: extendedTheme.colors.borderLight,\n },\n headerLeft: {\n flex: 1,\n },\n headerTitle: {\n ...extendedTheme.typography.h4,\n color: extendedTheme.colors.gameAccent,\n fontWeight: '600',\n },\n promptText: {\n ...extendedTheme.typography.h3,\n color: extendedTheme.colors.primary,\n fontWeight: '700',\n marginTop: extendedTheme.spacing.xs,\n },\n timerContainer: {\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.primary,\n paddingHorizontal: extendedTheme.spacing.sm,\n paddingVertical: extendedTheme.spacing.xs,\n borderRadius: extendedTheme.borderRadius.sm,\n },\n timerText: {\n ...extendedTheme.typography.bodySmall,\n color: extendedTheme.colors.background,\n fontWeight: '600',\n },\n timerWarning: {\n color: extendedTheme.colors.warning,\n },\n guessesContainer: {\n flex: 1,\n paddingHorizontal: extendedTheme.spacing.lg,\n },\n guessesList: {\n flex: 1,\n },\n guessesContent: {\n paddingVertical: extendedTheme.spacing.sm,\n },\n noGuessesText: {\n ...extendedTheme.typography.body,\n color: extendedTheme.colors.textLight,\n textAlign: 'center',\n fontStyle: 'italic',\n paddingVertical: extendedTheme.spacing.xl,\n },\n guessItem: {\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.background,\n borderRadius: extendedTheme.borderRadius.md,\n padding: extendedTheme.spacing.sm,\n marginBottom: extendedTheme.spacing.sm,\n borderLeftWidth: 3,\n borderLeftColor: extendedTheme.colors.border,\n },\n correctGuessItem: {\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.success + '20',\n borderLeftColor: extendedTheme.colors.success,\n },\n latestGuessItem: {\n borderLeftColor: extendedTheme.colors.primary,\n },\n guessText: {\n ...extendedTheme.typography.body,\n color: extendedTheme.colors.text,\n marginBottom: extendedTheme.spacing.xs,\n },\n correctGuessText: {\n color: extendedTheme.colors.success,\n fontWeight: '600',\n },\n guessTime: {\n ...extendedTheme.typography.caption,\n color: extendedTheme.colors.textLight,\n alignSelf: 'flex-end',\n },\n inputContainer: {\n flexDirection: 'row',\n paddingHorizontal: extendedTheme.spacing.lg,\n paddingVertical: extendedTheme.spacing.md,\n borderTopWidth: 1,\n borderTopColor: extendedTheme.colors.borderLight,\n submitButton: {\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.primary,\n borderRadius: extendedTheme.borderRadius.md,\n paddingHorizontal: extendedTheme.spacing.md,\n paddingVertical: extendedTheme.spacing.sm,\n justifyContent: 'center',\n alignItems: 'center',\n minWidth: 70,\n },\n submitButtonDisabled: {\n backgroundColor: extendedTheme.colors.textLight,\n },\n submitButtonText: {\n ...extendedTheme.typography.button,\n color: extendedTheme.colors.background,\n fontSize: 14,\n },\n submitButtonTextDisabled: {\n opacity: 0.7,\n },\n successOverlay: {\n position: 'absolute',\n 'cow', 'pig', 'duck', 'frog', \n 'bee', 'ant', 'owl', 'fox', 'bear', 'lion', 'tiger', 'mouse'\n ],\n objects: [\n 'car', 'house', 'tree', 'sun', 'moon', 'star', 'ball', 'book',\n 'cup', 'hat', 'shoe', 'key', 'door', 'window', 'chair', 'table'\n ],\n food: [\n 'apple', 'banana', 'pizza', 'cake', 'bread', 'egg', 'milk', 'ice cream',\n 'cookie', 'candy', 'orange', 'grape', 'cheese', 'fish', 'chicken',
