IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "play_date/PlayDateApp/AUTH_TROUBLESHOOTING.md", "file_content": "# Authentication Troubleshooting Guide\n\n## Error: \"Token validation failed, removing stored token\"\n\nThis error occurs when the React Native app cannot validate the stored JWT token with the server. Here are the most common causes and solutions:\n\n### 1. **Server Not Running** \u26a0\ufe0f\n**Problem**: Your backend server is not running on port 5000.\n\n**Solution**:\n```bash\n# Navigate to your server directory\ncd path/to/your/server\n\n# Start the server (adjust command based on your setup)\nnpm start\n# or\nnode server.js\n# or\npython app.py\n```\n\n**Verify**: Check that you see server startup logs and it's listening on port 5000.\n\n### 2. **Network Connectivity Issues** \ud83c\udf10\n**Problem**: React Native can't reach `localhost:5000` from the emulator/device.\n\n**Solutions by Platform**:\n\n#### Android Emulator:\n```typescript\n// In src/services/api.ts, use:\nconst API_BASE_URL = 'http://10.0.2.2:5000';\n```\n\n#### iOS Simulator:\n```typescript\n// In src/services/api.ts, use:\nconst API_BASE_URL = 'http://localhost:5000';\n```\n\n#### Physical Device:\n```typescript\n// Replace YOUR_COMPUTER_IP with your actual IP address\nconst API_BASE_URL = 'http://YOUR_COMPUTER_IP:5000';\n```\n\n**Find Your Computer's IP**:\n- **Windows**: `ipconfig` (look for IPv4 Address)\n- **Mac/Linux**: `ifconfig` or `ip addr show`\n\n### 3. **Server Endpoint Issues** \ud83d\udd27\n**Problem**: Server doesn't have the correct authentication endpoints.\n\n**Required Endpoints**:\n- `GET /auth/me` - Validate token and return user info\n- `POST /auth/login` - User login\n- `POST /auth/register` - User registration\n- `POST /auth/logout` - User logout (optional)\n\n**Expected Response Format**:\n```json\n// GET /auth/me success response\n{\n \"user\": {\n \"id\": \"user_id\",\n \"username\": \"username\",\n \"email\": \"user@example.com\",\n \"displayName\": \"Display Name\"\n }\n}\n\n// Error response\n{\n \"error\": \"Token expired\"\n}\n```\n\n### 4. **Token Format Issues** \ud83d\udd11\n**Problem**: Server expects different token format or header.\n\n**Check Token Header**:\nThe app sends tokens as: `Authorization: Bearer <token>`\n\n**Server Validation**:\n```javascript\n// Example Express.js middleware\nconst authenticateToken = (req, res, next) => {\n const authHeader = req.headers['authorization'];\n const token = authHeader && authHeader.split(' ')[1]; // Bearer TOKEN\n \n if (!token) {\n return res.status(401).json({ error: 'Access token required' });\n }\n \n jwt.verify(token, process.env.JWT_SECRET, (err, user) => {\n if (err) {\n return res.status(403).json({ error: 'Invalid token' });\n }\n req.user = user;\n next();\n });\n};\n```\n\n### 5. **CORS Issues** \ud83d\udeab\n**Problem**: Server blocks requests from React Native app.\n\n**Solution** (Express.js example):\n```javascript\nconst cors = require('cors');\napp.use(cors({\n origin: true, // Allow all origins in development\n credentials: true\n}));\n```\n\n## Quick Debugging Steps\n\n### Step 1: Add Test Component\nAdd the `AuthTestComponent` to any screen temporarily:\n\n```tsx\nimport AuthTestComponent from '../components/AuthTestComponent';\n\n// In your render method:\n<AuthTestComponent />\n```\n\n### Step 2: Test Server Connection\n1. Use \"Test Server Connection\" button\n2. Check console logs for detailed error messages\n3. Verify server is reachable\n\n### Step 3: Check Token\n1. Use \"Check Token\" button to see if token exists\n2. Use \"Test Token Validation\" to test server validation\n3. Check console logs for API request/response details\n\n### Step 4: Monitor Console Logs\nLook for these log messages:\n```\nAuthContext: Checking for stored token...\nAPI Request: GET http://10.0.2.2:5000/auth/me\nAPI Response: 200 OK\nAuthContext: Token is valid, logging user in automatically\n```\n\n## Common Error Messages\n\n### \"Network request failed\"\n- **Cause**: Can't reach server\n- **Fix**: Check server is running and URL is correct\n\n### \"HTTP 401: Unauthorized\"\n- **Cause**: Token is expired or invalid\n- **Fix**: Login again to get new token\n\n### \"HTTP 404: Not Found\"\n- **Cause**: Server endpoint doesn't exist\n- **Fix**: Implement `/auth/me` endpoint on server\n\n### \"HTTP 500: Internal Server Error\"\n- **Cause**: Server error during token validation\n- **Fix**: Check server logs for detailed error\n\n## Environment-Specific Solutions\n\n### Development Environment\n```typescript\n// src/services/api.ts\nconst API_BASE_URL = __DEV__\n ? Platform.OS === 'android' \n ? 'http://10.0.2.2:5000' // Android emulator\n : 'http://localhost:5000' // iOS simulator\n : 'https://your-production-api.com';\n```\n\n### Production Environment\n- Use HTTPS URLs\n- Implement proper error handling\n- Add retry logic for network failures\n\n## Testing Checklist\n\n- [ ] Server is running on port 5000\n- [ ] Server has `/auth/me` endpoint\n- [ ] Server accepts `Bearer` token format\n- [ ] CORS is configured correctly\n- [ ] Network connectivity works\n- [ ] Token is stored correctly\n- [ ] Token validation returns user object\n\n## Still Having Issues?\n\n1. **Check Server Logs**: Look for incoming requests and errors\n2. **Use Network Inspector**: Enable network debugging in React Native\n3. **Test with Postman**: Manually test your API endpoints\n4. **Check Firewall**: Ensure port 5000 is not blocked\n5. **Try Different URLs**: Test with your computer's IP address\n\n## Quick Fix Commands\n\n```bash\n# Check if server is running\ncurl http://localhost:5000/health\n\n# Test auth endpoint manually\ncurl -H \"Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN\" http://localhost:5000/auth/me\n\n# Find your IP address\n# Windows:\nipconfig\n# Mac/Linux:\nifconfig | grep inet\n```\n\nRemember to replace `YOUR_TOKEN` with an actual JWT token from your app's storage."}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":2,"type":0,"content":"Now let me create a quick fix guide for the most common issues:

","workspace_file_chunks":[]},{"status":"success","request_id":"45a55644-fcc9-40e0-b6dd-8e464fd65b00","request_message":"","structured_output_nodes":[{"id":1,"type":0,"content":"## **Debugging Tools Added for Token Validation Issue**

I've enhanced the authentication system with comprehensive debugging tools to help identify why the token validation is failing. Here's what I've added:

### **️ New Debugging Features:**

1. **Enhanced API Logging** - Now logs all API requests and responses
2. **Network Debug Utility** - Tests server connectivity and token validation
3. **Enhanced Test Component** - Added server connection and token validation tests
4. **Comprehensive Error Logging** - More detailed error messages in console

### ** Most Likely Causes:**

The error "Token validation failed, removing stored token" is most commonly caused by:

1. ** Server Not Running** - Backend server isn't running on port 5000
2. ** Network Issues** - React Native can't reach `localhost:5000` 
3. ** Platform-Specific URLs** - Android emulator needs `http://10.0.2.2:5000`
4. ** Missing Endpoints** - Server doesn't have `/auth/me` endpoint

### **⚡ Quick Fix Steps:**

1. **Check Server Status**:
 ```bash
 # Make sure your server is running
 curl http://localhost:5000/health
 ```

2. **Update API URL for Android**:
 The API URL has been updated to `http://10.0.2.2:5000` for Android emulator compatibility.

3. **Use Debug Component**:
 Add this to any screen temporarily:
 ```tsx
 import AuthTestComponent from '../components/AuthTestComponent';
 
 // In your render:
 <AuthTestComponent />
 ```

4. **Test Connection**:
 - Use "Test Server Connection" button
 - Use "Test Token Validation" button
 - Check console logs for detailed errors

### ** What to Check:**

1. **Is your backend server running?**
2. **Does your server have a `GET /auth/me` endpoint?**
3. **Are you running on Android emulator?** (needs special URL)
4. **Check the console logs** for detailed error messages

### ** Console Logs to Look For:**

```
AuthContext: Checking for stored token...
API Request: GET http://10.0.2.2:5000/auth/me
API Response: 200 OK
AuthContext: Token is valid, logging user in automatically
```

If you see different messages, they'll help identify the exact issue.

### ** Complete Troubleshooting Guide:**

I've created a comprehensive troubleshooting guide at `AUTH_TROUBLESHOOTING.md` with solutions for all common issues.

**Next Steps:**
1. Add the `AuthTestComponent` to a screen
2. Use the "Test Server Connection" button
3. Check the console logs for specific error messages
4. Let me know what errors you see, and I can provide targeted solutions!

The enhanced debugging will show exactly where the connection is failing, making it much easier to fix the issue.

Path: play_date/PlayDateApp/README.md
 1	# PlayDate - Dating App with Cooperative Games
 2	
 3	A mobile-first dating application that connects users through simple, cooperative 2-player games.
 4	
 5	## Project Overview
 6	
 7	PlayDate differentiates itself by offering users the ability to connect through casual cooperative games, prioritizing minimalism, ease of use, and a professional design aesthetic.
 8	
 9	## Tech Stack
 10	
 11	- **Frontend**: React Native with Expo
 12	- **Language**: TypeScript
 13	- **Navigation**: React Navigation (to be added)
 14	- **State Management**: React Context + Hooks
 15	- **Backend**: Node.js/Express (to be implemented)
 16	- **Database**: PostgreSQL + Redis
 17	- **Real-time**: WebSocket/Socket.io
 18	
 19	## Project Structure
 20	
 21	```
 22	src/
 23	├── components/ # Reusable UI components
 24	├── screens/ # Screen components
 25	│ ├── Auth/ # Authentication screens
 26	│ ├── Profile/ # Profile management
 27	│ ├── Matching/ # Matchmaking screens
 28	│ ├── Games/ # Game lobby and results
 29	│ └── Chat/ # Chat functionality
 30	├── games/ # Game implementations
 31	│ ├── PuzzleConnect/ # Cooperative puzzle game
 32	│ ├── GuessAndDraw/ # Drawing and guessing game
 33	│ └── SurvivalChallenge/ # Reflex/timing game
 34	├── navigation/ # Navigation configuration
 35	├── services/ # API and external services
 36	├── hooks/ # Custom React hooks
 37	├── contexts/ # React contexts
...
Path: play_date/PlayDateApp/ARCHITECTURE.md
 1	# PlayDate App Architecture
 2	
 3	## Technology Stack
 4	
 5	### Frontend
 6	- **Framework**: React Native with Expo SDK 53
 7	- **Language**: TypeScript
 8	- **Navigation**: React Navigation (to be implemented)
 9	- **State Management**: React Context API + useReducer
 10	- **Styling**: StyleSheet with custom theme system
 11	- **Development**: Expo CLI for development and testing
 12	
 13	### Backend (Planned)
 14	- **Runtime**: Node.js
 15	- **Framework**: Express.js
 16	- **Database**: PostgreSQL (primary) + Redis (caching/sessions)
 17	- **Real-time**: Socket.io for game synchronization
 18	- **Authentication**: JWT tokens
 19	- **File Storage**: AWS S3 or similar for photos
 20	- **Deployment**: Docker containers on AWS/GCP
 21	
 22	## Project Structure
 23	
 24	```
 25	PlayDateApp/
 26	├── src/
 27	│ ├── components/ # Reusable UI components
 28	│ │ ├── common/ # Generic components (Button, Input, etc.)
 29	│ │ ├── game/ # Game-specific components
 30	│ │ └── profile/ # Profile-related components
 31	│ │
 32	│ ├── screens/ # Screen components
 33	│ │ ├── Auth/ # Authentication screens
 34	│ │ │ ├── WelcomeScreen.tsx
 35	│ │ │ ├── LoginScreen.tsx

 37	│ │ │ └── ProfileSetupScreen.tsx
 38	│ │ ├── Profile/ # Profile management
 39	│ │ ├── Matching/ # Matchmaking screens
 40	│ │ ├── Games/ # Game lobby and results
 41	│ │ └── Chat/ # Chat functionality
 42	│ │
 43	│ ├── games/ # Game implementations

 45	│ │ │ ├── PuzzleConnectGame.tsx
 46	│ │ │ ├── PuzzleGrid.tsx

 125	
 126	### Data Flow
 127	1. UI components dispatch actions to contexts
 128	2. Contexts manage local state and API calls
 129	3. Services handle API communication and WebSocket events
 130	4. Real-time updates flow through WebSocket to contexts
 131	
 132	## Game Architecture
 133	
 134	### Common Game Framework
 135	All games follow a consistent structure:
 136	- **Game Session**: Manages overall game state
 137	- **Player Interface**: Handles user input and display
 138	- **Synchronization**: Real-time state sync between players
 139	- **Results**: Score calculation and result display
 140	
 141	### Game-Specific Implementations
 142	1. **Puzzle Connect**: Grid-based puzzle with asymmetric information
 143	2. **Guess & Draw**: Canvas drawing with real-time stroke synchronization
 144	3. **Survival Challenge**: Physics-based collision detection
...

 1	import React from 'react';
 2	import { Text } from 'react-native';
 3	import { createBottomTabNavigator } from '@react-navigation/bottom-tabs';

 7	
 8	// Stack Navigators
 9	import DiscoverNavigator from './DiscoverNavigator';
 10	import MatchesNavigator from './MatchesNavigator';
 11	import GamesNavigator from './GamesNavigator';

Path: play_date/api/README.md
 1	# PlayDate Flask API
 2	
 3	A Flask REST API with PostgreSQL database and Docker support for the PlayDate project.
 4	
 5	## Features
 6	
 7	- RESTful API endpoints for user management and authentication
 8	- PostgreSQL database with SQLAlchemy ORM
 9	- CORS enabled for frontend integration
 10	- Docker containerization with multi-service setup
 11	- Health check endpoints with database connectivity
 12	- Production-ready with Gunicorn
 13	- Database migrations and initialization
 14	
 15	## API Endpoints
 16	
 17	### General
 18	- `GET /` - Welcome message and API info
 19	- `GET /health` - Health check endpoint with database status
 20	
 21	### Authentication
 22	- `POST /auth/register` - Register new user
 23	- `POST /auth/login` - User login

 97	
 98	 private async request<T>(
 99	 endpoint: string,
 100	 options: RequestInit = {}
 101	 ): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 102	 try {
 103	 const url = `${this.baseURL}${endpoint}`;
 104	 const token = await tokenManager.getToken();
 105	
 106	 const headers: HeadersInit = {
 107	 'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 108	 ...options.headers,
 109	 };
 110	
 111	 if (token) {
 112	 headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`;
 113	 }
 114	
 115	 const response = await fetch(url, {
 116	 ...options,
 117	 headers,
 118	 });
 119	
 120	 const data = await response.json();
 121	
 122	 if (!response.ok) {
 123	 // Handle token expiration
 124	 if (response.status === 401 && token) {
 125	 await tokenManager.removeToken();
 126	 return {
 127	 error: 'Session expired. Please log in again.',
 128	 };
 129	 }
 130	
 131	 return {
 132	 error: data.error || `HTTP ${response.status}: ${response.statusText}`,
 133	 };
 134	 }
 135	
 136	 return { data };
 137	 } catch (error) {
 138	 console.error('API request failed:', error);
 139	 return {
 140	 error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Network request failed',
 141	 };
 142	 }
 143	 }
 144	
 145	 async get<T>(endpoint: string): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 146	 return this.request<T>(endpoint, { method: 'GET' });
 147	 }
 148	
 149	 async post<T>(endpoint: string, body?: any): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 150	 return this.request<T>(endpoint, {
 151	 method: 'POST',
 152	 body: body ? JSON.stringify(body) : undefined,
 153	 });
 154	 }
 155	
 156	 async put<T>(endpoint: string, body?: any): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 157	 return this.request<T>(endpoint, {
 158	 method: 'PUT',
 159	 body: body ? JSON.stringify(body) : undefined,
 160	 });
 161	 }
 162	
 163	 async delete<T>(endpoint: string): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 164	 return this.request<T>(endpoint, { method: 'DELETE' });
 165	 }
 166	}

 51	
 52	// Game Types
 53	export type GameType = 'PuzzleConnect' | 'GuessAndDraw' | 'SurvivalChallenge';
 54	
 55	export interface GameSession {
 56	 id: string;
 57	 matchId: string;
 58	 gameType: GameType;
 59	 players: [string, string]; // User IDs
 60	 status: 'waiting' | 'active' | 'completed' | 'abandoned';
 61	 startedAt?: Date;
 62	 completedAt?: Date;
 63	 result?: GameResult;
 64	 gameData: any; // Game-specific data
 65	}
 66	
 67	export interface GameResult {
 68	 success: boolean;
 69	 score: number;
 70	 duration: number; // in seconds
 71	 playerStats: {
 72	 [userId: string]: {
 73	 performance: number;
 74	 actions: number;
 75	 };
 76	 };
 77	}
 78	
 79	// Game-specific Types
 80	export interface PuzzleConnectData {
 81	 gridSize: number;
 82	 playerAView: number[][];
 83	 playerBView: number[][];
 84	 solution: number[][];
 85	 cluesShared: string[];
 86	}
 87	
 88	export interface GuessAndDrawData {
 89	 currentDrawer: string;
 90	 prompt: string;
 91	 drawing: DrawingStroke[];
 92	 guesses: string[];
 93	 correctGuess?: string;
 94	}
 95	
 96	export interface DrawingStroke {
 97	 points: { x: number; y: number }[];
 98	 color: string;
 99	 width: number;
 100	 timestamp: number;
 101	}
 102	
 103	export interface SurvivalChallengeData {
 104	 obstacles: Obstacle[];
 105	 playerPositions: {
 106	 [userId: string]: { x: number; y: number };
 107	 };
 108	 gameSpeed: number;
 109	 survivedTime: number;
 110	}
 111	
 112	export interface Obstacle {
 113	 id: string;
 114	 x: number;
 115	 y: number;
 116	 width: number;
 117	 height: number;
 118	 speed: number;
 119	 type: 'static' | 'moving';
 120	}
 121	
 122	// Chat Types
 123	export interface ChatMessage {
 124	 id: string;
 125	 matchId: string;
 126	 senderId: string;
 127	 content: string;
 128	 type: 'text' | 'game_invite' | 'game_result' | 'system';
 129	 timestamp: Date;
 130	 read: boolean;
 131	}
 132	
 133	export interface ChatState {
 134	 messages: ChatMessage[];
 135	 isLoading: boolean;
 136	 error: string | null;
 137	}
 138	
 139	// Navigation Types
 140	export type RootStackParamList = {
 141	 Auth: undefined;
 142	 Main: undefined;
 143	 Profile: { userId?: string };
 144	 Matching: undefined;
 145	 GameLobby: { matchId: string; gameType: GameType };
 146	 GamePlay: { sessionId: string };
 147	 Chat: { matchId: string };
 148	};
 149	
 150	export type AuthStackParamList = {
 151	 Login: undefined;
 152	 Register: undefined;
 153	 ForgotPassword: undefined;
 154	};
 155	
 156	export type MainTabParamList = {
 157	 Discover: undefined;
 158	 Matches: undefined;
 159	 Games: undefined;
 160	 Profile: undefined;
 161	};
 162	
 163	// API Response Types
 164	export interface ApiResponse<T> {
 165	 success: boolean;
 166	 data?: T;
 167	 error?: string;
 168	 message?: string;
 169	}
 170	
 171	export interface PaginatedResponse<T> {
 172	 items: T[];
 173	 total: number;
 174	 page: number;
 175	 limit: number;
 176	 hasMore: boolean;
 177	}
 178	
 179	// WebSocket Types
 180	export interface WebSocketMessage {
 181	 type: string;
 182	 payload: any;
 183	 timestamp: Date;
 184	}
 185	
 186	export interface GameUpdateMessage extends WebSocketMessage {
 187	 type: 'game_update';
 188	 payload: {
 189	 sessionId: string;
 190	 gameData: any;
 191	 playerAction?: any;
 192	 };
 193	}
 194	
 195	// Error Types
 196	export interface AppError {
 197	 code: string;
 198	 message: string;
 199	 details?: any;
 200	}

 41	
 42	## MVP Games
 43	
 44	### 1. Puzzle Connect
 45	- **Type**: Cooperative puzzle-solving
 46	- **Duration**: 2–3 minutes per round
 47	- **Gameplay**: Players see different puzzle states and must share clues to solve a shared grid
 48	- **Co-op Mechanic**: Neither player can solve alone; asymmetric information drives communication
 49	
 50	### 2. Guess & Draw
 51	- **Type**: Turn-based drawing & guessing
 52	- **Duration**: 1–2 minutes per round
 53	- **Gameplay**: One player draws from a prompt, the other guesses
 54	- **Co-op Mechanic**: Both must succeed together (drawer communicates, guesser interprets)

 125	
 126	### Data Flow
 127	1. UI components dispatch actions to contexts
 128	2. Contexts manage local state and API calls
 129	3. Services handle API communication and WebSocket events
 130	4. Real-time updates flow through WebSocket to contexts
 131	
 132	## Game Architecture
 133	
 134	### Common Game Framework
 135	All games follow a consistent structure:
 136	- **Game Session**: Manages overall game state
 137	- **Player Interface**: Handles user input and display
 138	- **Synchronization**: Real-time state sync between players
 139	- **Results**: Score calculation and result display
 140	
 141	### Game-Specific Implementations
 142	1. **Puzzle Connect**: Grid-based puzzle with asymmetric information
 143	2. **Guess & Draw**: Canvas drawing with real-time stroke synchronization
 144	3. **Survival Challenge**: Physics-based collision detection

 1	import React, { createContext, useContext, useReducer, useEffect, ReactNode } from 'react';
 2	import { User, AuthState } from '../types';
 3	import { authService, tokenManager } from '../services/api';
 4	import { mapApiUserToUser, mapRegisterDataToApi } from '../services/userMapper';
 5	
 6	// Auth Actions
 7	type AuthAction =
 8	 | { type: 'AUTH_START' }
 9	 | { type: 'AUTH_SUCCESS'; payload: User }
 10	 | { type: 'AUTH_FAILURE'; payload: string }
 11	 | { type: 'LOGOUT' }
 12	 | { type: 'UPDATE_USER'; payload: Partial<User> }
 13	 | { type: 'CLEAR_ERROR' };
 14	
 15	// Auth Context Type
 16	interface AuthContextType {
 17	 state: AuthState;
 18	 login: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;
 19	 register: (userData: RegisterData) => Promise<void>;
 20	 logout: () => Promise<void>;
 21	 updateUser: (userData: Partial<User>) => Promise<void>;
 22	 clearError: () => void;
 23	}
 24	
 25	// Register Data Type
 26	interface RegisterData {
 27	 email: string;
 28	 password: string;
 29	 name: string;
 30	 age: number;
 31	 bio?: string;
 32	 city?: string;
 33	 interests?: string[];
 34	}
 35	
 36	// Initial State
 37	const initialState: AuthState = {
 38	 user: null,
 39	 isAuthenticated: false,
 40	 isLoading: false,
 41	 error: null,
 42	};
 43	
 44	// Auth Reducer
 45	const authReducer = (state: AuthState, action: AuthAction): AuthState => {
 46	 switch (action.type) {
 47	 case 'AUTH_START':
 48	 return {
 49	 ...state,
 50	 isLoading: true,
 51	 error: null,
 52	 };
 53	 
 54	 case 'AUTH_SUCCESS':
 55	 return {
 56	 ...state,
 57	 user: action.payload,
 58	 isAuthenticated: true,
 59	 isLoading: false,
 60	 error: null,
 61	 };
 62	 
 63	 case 'AUTH_FAILURE':
 64	 return {
 65	 ...state,
 66	 user: null,
 67	 isAuthenticated: false,
 68	 isLoading: false,
 69	 error: action.payload,
 70	 };
 71	 
 72	 case 'LOGOUT':
 73	 return {
 74	 ...initialState,
 75	 };
 76	 
 77	 case 'UPDATE_USER':
 78	 return {
 79	 ...state,
 80	 user: state.user ? { ...state.user, ...action.payload } : null,
 81	 };
 82	 
 83	 case 'CLEAR_ERROR':
 84	 return {
 85	 ...state,
 86	 error: null,
 87	 };
 88	 
 89	 default:
 90	 return state;
 91	 }
 92	};
...
 110	
 111	 const checkAuthStatus = async () => {
 112	 try {
 113	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_START' });
 114	
 115	 // Check if we have a stored token
 116	 const token = await tokenManager.getToken();
 117	
 118	 if (!token) {
 119	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_FAILURE', payload: 'No stored authentication found' });
 120	 return;
 121	 }
 122	
 123	 // Validate token with backend by getting current user
 124	 const response = await authService.getCurrentUser();
 125	
 126	 if (response.data?.user) {
 127	 const user = mapApiUserToUser(response.data.user);
 128	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_SUCCESS', payload: user });
 129	 } else {
 130	 // Token is invalid, remove it
 131	 await tokenManager.removeToken();
 132	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_FAILURE', payload: response.error || 'Invalid token' });
 133	 }
...
 231	 } catch (error) {
 232	 const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Failed to update user';
 233	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_FAILURE', payload: errorMessage });
 234	 throw error;
 235	 }
 236	 };
 237	
 238	 const clearError = () => {
 239	 dispatch({ type: 'CLEAR_ERROR' });
 240	 };
 241	
 242	 const value: AuthContextType = {
 243	 state,
 244	 login,
 245	 register,
 246	 logout,
 247	 updateUser,
 248	 clearError,
 249	 };
 250	
 251	 return (
 252	 <AuthContext.Provider value={value}>
 253	 {children}
 254	 </AuthContext.Provider>
 255	 );
 256	};
 257	
 258	// Custom hook to use Auth Context
 259	export const useAuth = (): AuthContextType => {
 260	 const context = useContext(AuthContext);
 261	 if (context === undefined) {
 262	 throw new Error('useAuth must be used within an AuthProvider');
 263	 }
 264	 return context;
 265	};
 266	
 267	export default AuthContext;

 1	import AsyncStorage from '@react-native-async-storage/async-storage';
 2	
 3	// API Configuration
 4	// For React Native development, we need to use the actual IP address
 5	// localhost won't work from the mobile simulator/device
 6	const API_BASE_URL = __DEV__
 7	 ? 'http://localhost:5000' // This will work for web, but needs IP for mobile
 8	 : 'http://localhost:5000'; // Production URL would go here
 9	const TOKEN_KEY = 'auth_token';
 10	
 11	// Types
 12	export interface ApiResponse<T> {
 13	 data?: T;
 14	 message?: string;
 15	 error?: string;
 16	}
 17	
 18	export interface LoginRequest {
 19	 email: string;
 20	 password: string;
 21	}
 22	
 23	export interface RegisterRequest {
 24	 name: string;
 25	 email: string;
 26	 password: string;
 27	 age?: number;
 28	 bio?: string;
 29	 city?: string;
 30	 latitude?: number;
 31	 longitude?: number;
 32	 interests?: string[];
 33	 photos?: string[];
 34	 preferences?: {
 35	 ageRange?: { min: number; max: number };
 36	 maxDistance?: number;
 37	 gameTypes?: string[];
 38	 };
 39	}
 40	
 41	export interface AuthResponse {
 42	 user: {
 43	 id: number;
 44	 email: string;
 45	 name: string;
 46	 age?: number;
 47	 bio?: string;
 48	 city?: string;
 49	 latitude?: number;
 50	 longitude?: number;
 51	 interests: string[];
 52	 photos: string[];
 53	 preferences: any;
 54	 is_active: boolean;
 55	 created_at: string;
 56	 updated_at: string;
 57	 };
 58	 access_token: string;
 59	 message: string;
 60	}
 61	
 62	// Token Management
 63	export const tokenManager = {
 64	 async getToken(): Promise<string | null> {
 65	 try {
 66	 return await AsyncStorage.getItem(TOKEN_KEY);
 67	 } catch (error) {
 68	 console.error('Error getting token:', error);
 69	 return null;
 70	 }
 71	 },
 72	
 73	 async setToken(token: string): Promise<void> {
 74	 try {
 75	 await AsyncStorage.setItem(TOKEN_KEY, token);
 76	 } catch (error) {
 77	 console.error('Error setting token:', error);
 78	 }
 79	 },
 80	
 81	 async removeToken(): Promise<void> {
 82	 try {
 83	 await AsyncStorage.removeItem(TOKEN_KEY);
 84	 } catch (error) {
 85	 console.error('Error removing token:', error);
 86	 }
 87	 },
 88	};
 89	
 90	// HTTP Client
 91	class ApiClient {
 92	 private baseURL: string;
 93	
 94	 constructor(baseURL: string) {
 95	 this.baseURL = baseURL;
 96	 }
 97	
 98	 private async request<T>(
 99	 endpoint: string,
 100	 options: RequestInit = {}
 101	 ): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 102	 try {
 103	 const url = `${this.baseURL}${endpoint}`;
 104	 const token = await tokenManager.getToken();
 105	
 106	 const headers: HeadersInit = {
 107	 'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 108	 ...options.headers,
 109	 };
 110	
 111	 if (token) {
 112	 headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`;
 113	 }
 114	
 115	 const response = await fetch(url, {
 116	 ...options,
 117	 headers,
 118	 });
 119	
 120	 const data = await response.json();
 121	
 122	 if (!response.ok) {
 123	 // Handle token expiration
 124	 if (response.status === 401 && token) {
 125	 await tokenManager.removeToken();
 126	 return {
 127	 error: 'Session expired. Please log in again.',
 128	 };
 129	 }
 130	
 131	 return {
 132	 error: data.error || `HTTP ${response.status}: ${response.statusText}`,
 133	 };
 134	 }
 135	
 136	 return { data };
 137	 } catch (error) {
 138	 console.error('API request failed:', error);
 139	 return {
 140	 error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Network request failed',
 141	 };
 142	 }
 143	 }
 144	
 145	 async get<T>(endpoint: string): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 146	 return this.request<T>(endpoint, { method: 'GET' });
 147	 }
 148	
 149	 async post<T>(endpoint: string, body?: any): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 150	 return this.request<T>(endpoint, {
 151	 method: 'POST',
 152	 body: body ? JSON.stringify(body) : undefined,
 153	 });

 171	// Auth Service
 172	export const authService = {
 173	 async login(credentials: LoginRequest): Promise<ApiResponse<AuthResponse>> {
 174	 const response = await apiClient.post<AuthResponse>('/auth/login', credentials);
 175	 
 176	 if (response.data?.access_token) {
 177	 await tokenManager.setToken(response.data.access_token);
 178	 }
 179	 
 180	 return response;
 181	 },
 182	
 183	 async register(userData: RegisterRequest): Promise<ApiResponse<AuthResponse>> {
 184	 const response = await apiClient.post<AuthResponse>('/auth/register', userData);
 185	 
 186	 if (response.data?.access_token) {
 187	 await tokenManager.setToken(response.data.access_token);
 188	 }
 189	 
 190	 return response;
 191	 },
 192	
 193	 async getCurrentUser(): Promise<ApiResponse<{ user: AuthResponse['user'] }>> {
 194	 return apiClient.get<{ user: AuthResponse['user'] }>('/auth/me');
 195	 },
 196

 198	 await tokenManager.removeToken();
 199	 },

 210	 },
 211	
 212	 async updateUser(id: number, userData: Partial<RegisterRequest>): Promise<ApiResponse<{ user: AuthResponse['user'] }>> {
 213	 return apiClient.put<{ user: AuthResponse['user'] }>(`/users/${id}`, userData);
 214	 },
 215	
 216	 async deleteUser(id: number): Promise<ApiResponse<{ message: string }>> {
 217	 return apiClient.delete<{ message: string }>(`/users/${id}`);
 218	 },
 219	};

 102	// Auth Provider Component
 103	export const AuthProvider: React.FC<AuthProviderProps> = ({ children }) => {
 104	 const [state, dispatch] = useReducer(authReducer, initialState);
 105	
 106	 // Check for existing authentication on app start
 107	 useEffect(() => {
 108	 checkAuthStatus();
 109	 }, []);
 110	
 111	 const checkAuthStatus = async () => {
 112	 try {
 113	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_START' });
 114	
 115	 // Check if we have a stored token
 116	 const token = await tokenManager.getToken();
 117	
 118	 if (!token) {
 119	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_FAILURE', payload: 'No stored authentication found' });
 120	 return;
 121	 }
 122	
 123	 // Validate token with backend by getting current user
 124	 const response = await authService.getCurrentUser();
 125	
 126	 if (response.data?.user) {
 127	 const user = mapApiUserToUser(response.data.user);
 128	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_SUCCESS', payload: user });
 129	 } else {
 130	 // Token is invalid, remove it
 131	 await tokenManager.removeToken();
 132	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_FAILURE', payload: response.error || 'Invalid token' });
 133	 }
 134	 } catch (error) {
 135	 console.error('Auth check failed:', error);
 136	 await tokenManager.removeToken();
 137	 dispatch({ type: 'AUTH_FAILURE', payload: 'Failed to check authentication status' });
 138	 }
 139	 };

 45	// Auth Reducer
 46	const authReducer = (state: AuthState, action: AuthAction): AuthState => {
 47	 switch (action.type) {
 48	 case 'AUTH_START':
 49	 return {
 50	 ...state,
 51	 isLoading: true,
 52	 error: null,
 53	 };
 54	 
 55	 case 'AUTH_SUCCESS':
 56	 return {
 57	 ...state,
 58	 user: action.payload,
 59	 isAuthenticated: true,
 60	 isLoading: false,
 61	 error: null,
 62	 };
 63	 
 64	 case 'AUTH_FAILURE':
 65	 return {
 66	 ...state,
 67	 user: null,
 68	 isAuthenticated: false,
 69	 isLoading: false,
 70	 error: action.payload,
 71	 };
 72	 
 73	 case 'LOGOUT':
 74	 return {
 75	 ...initialState,
 76	 };
 77	 
 78	 case 'UPDATE_USER':
 79	 return {
 80	 ...state,
 81	 user: state.user ? { ...state.user, ...action.payload } : null,
 82	 };
 83	 
 84	 case 'CLEAR_ERROR':
 85	 return {
 86	 ...state,
 87	 error: null,
 88	 };
 89	 
 90	 default:
 91	 return state;
 92	 }
 93	};

 1	import AsyncStorage from '@react-native-async-storage/async-storage';
 2	
 3	// API Configuration
 4	// For React Native development, we need to use the actual IP address
 5	// localhost won't work from the mobile simulator/device
 6	const API_BASE_URL = __DEV__
 7	 ? 'http://localhost:5000' // This will work for web, but needs IP for mobile
 8	 : 'http://localhost:5000'; // Production URL would go here
 9	const TOKEN_KEY = 'auth_token';
 10	
 11	// Types
 12	export interface ApiResponse<T> {
 13	 data?: T;
 14	 message?: string;
 15	 error?: string;
 16	}
 17	
 18	export interface LoginRequest {
 19	 email: string;
 20	 password: string;
 21	}
 22	
 23	export interface RegisterRequest {
 24	 name: string;
 25	 email: string;
 26	 password: string;
 27	 age?: number;
 28	 bio?: string;
 29	 city?: string;
 30	 latitude?: number;
 31	 longitude?: number;
 32	 interests?: string[];
 33	 photos?: string[];
 34	 preferences?: {
 35	 ageRange?: { min: number; max: number };
 36	 maxDistance?: number;
 37	 gameTypes?: string[];
 38	 };
 39	}
 40	
 41	export interface AuthResponse {
 42	 user: {
 43	 id: number;
 44	 email: string;
 45	 name: string;
 46	 age?: number;
 47	 bio?: string;
 48	 city?: string;
 49	 latitude?: number;
 50	 longitude?: number;
 51	 interests: string[];
 52	 photos: string[];
 53	 preferences: any;
 54	 is_active: boolean;
 55	 created_at: string;
 56	 updated_at: string;
 57	 };
 58	 access_token: string;
 59	 message: string;
 60	}
 61	
 62	// Token Management
 63	export const tokenManager = {
 64	 async getToken(): Promise<string | null> {
 65	 try {
 66	 return await AsyncStorage.getItem(TOKEN_KEY);
 67	 } catch (error) {
 68	 console.error('Error getting token:', error);
 69	 return null;
 70	 }
 71	 },
 72	
 73	 async setToken(token: string): Promise<void> {
 74	 try {
 75	 await AsyncStorage.setItem(TOKEN_KEY, token);
 76	 } catch (error) {
 77	 console.error('Error setting token:', error);
 78	 }
 79	 },
 80	
 81	 async removeToken(): Promise<void> {
 82	 try {
 83	 await AsyncStorage.removeItem(TOKEN_KEY);
 84	 } catch (error) {
 85	 console.error('Error removing token:', error);
 86	 }
 87	 },
 88	};
 89	
 90	// HTTP Client
 91	class ApiClient {
 92	 private baseURL: string;
 93	
 94	 constructor(baseURL: string) {
 95	 this.baseURL = baseURL;
 96	 }
 97	
 98	 private async request<T>(
 99	 endpoint: string,
 100	 options: RequestInit = {}
 101	 ): Promise<ApiResponse<T>> {
 102	 try {
 103	 const url = `${this.baseURL}${endpoint}`;
 104	 const token = await tokenManager.getToken();
 105	
 106	 const headers: HeadersInit = {
 107	 'Content-Type': 'application/json',
 108	 ...options.headers,
 109	 };
 110	
 111	 if (token) {
 112	 headers.Authorization = `Bearer ${token}`;
 113	 }
 114	
 115	 const response = await fetch(url, {
 116	 ...options,
 117	 headers,
 118	 });
 119	
 120	 const data = await response.json();
 121	
 122	 if (!response.ok) {
 123	 // Handle token expiration
 124	 if (response.status === 401 && token) {
 125	 await tokenManager.removeToken();
 126	 return {
 127	 error: 'Session expired. Please log in again.',
 128	 };
 129	 }
 130	
 131	 return {
 132	 error: data.error || `HTTP ${response.status}: ${response.statusText}`,
 133	 };
 134	 }
...

 172	export const authService = {
 173	 async login(credentials: LoginRequest): Promise<ApiResponse<AuthResponse>> {
 174	 const response = await apiClient.post<AuthResponse>('/auth/login', credentials);
 175	 
 176	 if (response.data?.access_token) {
 177	 await tokenManager.setToken(response.data.access_token);
 178	 }
 179

 181	 },
 182	
 183	 async register(userData: RegisterRequest): Promise<ApiResponse<AuthResponse>> {

 185

 187	 await tokenManager.setToken(response.data.access_token);
 188	 }
 189	 
 190	 return response;
 191	 },
 192	
 193	 async getCurrentUser(): Promise<ApiResponse<{ user: AuthResponse['user'] }>> {
 194	 return apiClient.get<{ user: AuthResponse['user'] }>('/auth/me');

 196

 198	 await tokenManager.removeToken();
 199	 },
 200	};
 201	
 202	// User Service

 206	 },
 207	
 208	 async getUser(id: number): Promise<ApiResponse<{ user: AuthResponse['user'] }>> {
 209	 return apiClient.get<{ user: AuthResponse['user'] }>(`/users/${id}`);
 210	 },
 211	
 212	 async updateUser(id: number, userData: Partial<RegisterRequest>): Promise<ApiResponse<{ user: AuthResponse['user'] }>> {
 213	 return apiClient.put<{ user: AuthResponse['user'] }>(`/users/${id}`, userData);
 214	 },
 215	
 216	 async deleteUser(id: number): Promise<ApiResponse<{ message: string }>> {
 217	 return apiClient.delete<{ message: string }>(`/users/${id}`);
 218	 },
 219	};

 17	interface AuthContextType {
 18	 state: AuthState;
 19	 login: (email: string, password: string) => Promise<void>;
 20	 register: (userData: RegisterData) => Promise<void>;
 21	 logout: () => Promise<void>;
 22	 updateUser: (userData: Partial<User>) => Promise<void>;
 23	 clearError: () => void;
 24	 checkAuthStatus: () => Promise<void>;
 25	}
 26	
 27	// Register Data Type

 29	 email: string;

 31	 name: string;
 32	 age: number;

 34	 city?: string;

 38	// Initial State
 39	const initialState: AuthState = {
 40	 user: null,
 41	 isAuthenticated: false,
 42	 isLoading: true, // Start with loading true for initial auth check
 43	 error: null,
 44	};
 45	
 46	// Auth Reducer
 47	const authReducer = (state: AuthState, action: AuthAction): AuthState => {
 48	 switch (action.type) {
 49	 case 'AUTH_START':
 50	 return {
 51	 ...state,
 52	 isLoading: true,
 53	 error: null,
 54	 };
 55	 
 56	 case 'AUTH_SUCCESS':
 57	 return {
 58	 ...state,
 59	 user: action.payload,
 60	 isAuthenticated: true,
 61	 isLoading: false,
 62	 error: null,
 63	 };
 64	 
 65	 case 'AUTH_FAILURE':
 66	 return {
 67	 ...state,
 68	 user: null,
 69	 isAuthenticated: false,
 70	 isLoading: false,
 71	 error: action.payload,
 72	 };
 73	 
 74	 case 'LOGOUT':
 75	 return {
 76	 ...initialState,
 77	 isLoading: false, // Don't show loading screen after logout
 78	 };
 79	 
 80	 case 'UPDATE_USER':
 81	 return {
 82	 ...state,
 83	 user: state.user ? { ...state.user, ...action.payload } : null,
 84	 };
 85	 
 86	 case 'CLEAR_ERROR':
 87	 return {
 88	 ...state,
 89	 error: null,
 90	 };
 91	
 92	 case 'INITIAL_LOAD_COMPLETE':
 93	 return {
 94	 ...state,
 95	 isLoading: false,
 96	 };
